params.label: $aArray
params.documentation: Array to modify

_ArrayDisplay.documentation: Displays a 1D or 2D array in a ListView
_ArrayDisplay.label: _ArrayDisplay ( Const ByRef $aArray [, $sTitle = "ArrayDisplay" [, $sArrayRange = "" [, $iFlags = 0 [, $vUser_Separator = Default [, $sHeader = Default [, $iMax_ColWidth = Default [, $iAlt_Color = Default [, $hUser_Function = ""]]]]]]]] )

params.label: $aArray
params.documentation: Array to display

params.label: $sTitle
params.documentation: [optional] Title for dialog. Default = "ArrayDisplay".

params.label: $sArrayRange
params.documentation: [optional] Range of rows/columns to display. Default ("") = entire array. (See below for details)

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] Determine UDF options. Add required values together    0 = (default) Column text alignment - left    1 = Transposes the array    2 = Column text alignment - right    4 = Column text alignment - center    8 = Verbose - display MsgBox on error and splash screens during processing of large arrays    16 = Only 'Copy' buttons displayed    32 = No buttons displayed    64 = No 'Row' column displayed

params.label: $vUser_Separator
params.documentation: [optional] Sets column display option when copying data to clipboard. Character = Delimiter between columns. Number = Fixed column width - longer items will be truncated.    Default = Current separator character (usually "|").

params.label: $sHeader
params.documentation: [optional] Column names in header (string of names separated by current separator character - usually "|"). Default see Remarks.

params.label: $iMax_Colwidth
params.documentation: [optional] Max width to which a ListView column will expand to show content. Default = 350 pixels.

params.label: $iAlt_Color
params.documentation: [optional] ListView alternate rows set to defined color. Default = all rows ListView background color.

params.label: $hUser_Function
params.documentation: [optional] A variable assigned to the user defined function to run. Default = none. See remarks.

_ClipBoard_Open.documentation: Opens the clipboard and prevents other applications from modifying the clipboard
_ClipBoard_Open.label: _ClipBoard_Open ( $hOwner )

params.label: $hOwner
params.documentation: Handle to the window to be associated with the open clipboard. If this parameter is 0, the open clipboard is associated with the current task.

params.label: $sFormat
params.documentation: The name of the new format

_ClipBoard_SetData.documentation: Places data on the clipboard in a specified clipboard format
_ClipBoard_SetData.label: _ClipBoard_SetData ( $vData [, $iFormat = 1] )

params.label: $vData
params.documentation: Data in Binary or String format, or optionally NULL (0) (owner must render, see below).IMPORTANT: If a String is passed, and it is not of type $CF_TEXT, $CF_OEMTEXT, or $CF_UNICODETEXT, it will be treated as an ANSI string.To force Unicode strings for other types, you must pass the data in Binary format.Also, do NOT pass $CF_UNICODETEXT in Binary format (causes garbled data).When $vData is NULL, it indicates that the window provides data in the specified clipboard format upon request.If a window delays rendering, it must process the $WM_RENDERFORMAT and $WM_RENDERALLFORMATS messages.If this function succeeds, the system owns the object identified by the $hMemory parameter.The application may not write to or free the data once ownership has been transferred to the system, but it can lock and read from the data until the _ClipBoard_Close() function is called.The memory must be unlocked before the clipboard is closed.If the $hMemory parameter identifies a memory object, the object must have been allocated using the function with the $GMEM_MOVEABLE flag.

params.label: $iFormat
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies a clipboard format

_ClipBoard_SetDataEx.documentation: Places data on the clipboard in a specified clipboard format
_ClipBoard_SetDataEx.label: _ClipBoard_SetDataEx ( ByRef $hMemory [, $iFormat = 1] )

params.label: $hMemory
params.documentation: Handle to the data in the specified format. This parameter can be NULL, indicating that the window provides data in the specified clipboard format upon request.If a window delays rendering, it must process the $WM_RENDERFORMAT and $WM_RENDERALLFORMATS messages.If this function succeeds, the system owns the object identified by the $hMemory parameter.The application may not write to or free the data once ownership has been transferred to the system, but it can lock and read from the data until the _ClipBoard_Close() function is called.The memory must be unlocked before the clipboard is closed.If the $hMemory parameter identifies a memory object, the object must have been allocated using the function with the $GMEM_MOVEABLE flag.

params.label: $iFormat
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies a clipboard format

_Date_Time_SetFileTime.documentation: Sets the date and time that a file was created, accessed and modified
_Date_Time_SetFileTime.label: _Date_Time_SetFileTime ( $hFile, $tCreateTime, $tLastAccess, $tLastWrite )

params.label: $hFile
params.documentation: Handle to the file. The file handle must have been created using the CreateFile function with the FILE_WRITE_ATTRIBUTES access right.

params.label: $tCreateTime
params.documentation: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was created.This be 0 if the application does not need to set this information.

params.label: $tLastAccess
params.documentation: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was last accessed.The last access time includes the last time the file was written to, read from, or (in the case of executable files) run.This can be 0 if the application does not need to set this information.To preserve the existing last access time for a file even after accessing a file, call SetFileTime with this parameter set to -1 before closing the file handle.

params.label: $tLastWrite
params.documentation: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was last written to.This can be 0 if the application does not want to set this information.

_Date_Time_SetSystemTimeAdjustment.documentation: Enables or disables periodic time adjustments to the system's time of day clock
_Date_Time_SetSystemTimeAdjustment.label: _Date_Time_SetSystemTimeAdjustment ( $iAdjustment, $bDisabled )

params.label: $iAdjustment
params.documentation: The number of 100 nanosecond units added to the time of day clock at each clock interrupt if periodic time adjustment is enabled.

params.label: $bDisabled
params.documentation: A value of True specifies that periodic time adjustment is to be disabled. The system is free to adjust time of day using its own internal mechanisms. The system's internal adjustment mechanisms may cause the time-of-day clock to jump noticeably when adjustments are made. A value of False specifies that periodic time adjustment is to be enabled, and will be used to adjust the time of day clock. The system will not interfere with the time adjustment scheme, and will not attempt to synchronize time of day on its own.The system will add the value of $iAdjustment to the time of day at each clock interrupt.

_Date_Time_SetTimeZoneInformation.documentation: Sets the current time zone settings
_Date_Time_SetTimeZoneInformation.label: _Date_Time_SetTimeZoneInformation ( $iBias, $sStdName, $tStdDate, $iStdBias, $sDayName, $tDayDate, $iDayBias )

params.label: $iBias
params.documentation: The current bias for local time translation on this computer. The bias is the difference in minutes between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time.All translations between UTC and local time use the following formula: UTC = local time + bias

params.label: $sStdName
params.documentation: The description for standard time

params.label: $tStdDate
params.documentation: A $tagSYSTEMTIME structure that contains a date and local time when the transition from daylight saving time to standard time occurs.

params.label: $iStdBias
params.documentation: The bias value to be used during local time translations that occur during standard time. This value is added to the value of the Bias to form the bias used during standard time. In most time zones, this value is zero.

params.label: $sDayName
params.documentation: The description for daylight saving time

params.label: $tDayDate
params.documentation: A $tagSYSTEMTIME structure that contains a date and local time when the transition from standard time to daylight saving time occurs.

params.label: $iDayBias
params.documentation: The bias value to be used during local time translation that occur during daylight saving time. This value is added to the value of the Bias member to form the bias used during daylight saving time. In most time zones this value is –60.

params.label: $tSYSTEMTIME
params.documentation: $tagSYSTEMTIME structure

_Date_Time_SystemTimeToTzSpecificLocalTi.documentation: Converts a UTC time to a specified time zone's corresponding local time
_Date_Time_SystemTimeToTzSpecificLocalTi.label: _Date_Time_SystemTimeToTzSpecificLocalTime ( $tUTC [, $tTimeZone = 0] )

params.label: $tUTC
params.documentation: a $tagSYSTEMTIME structure that specifies a time in UTC or a pointer to it. The function converts this time to the specified time zone's local time.

params.label: $tTimeZone
params.documentation: [optional] a $tagTIME_ZONE_INFORMATION structure that specifies the time zone of interest or a pointer to it.If 0, the function uses the currently active time zone.

_Date_Time_TzSpecificLocalTimeToSystemTi.documentation: Converts a local time to a time in UTC

params.label: $tLocalTime
params.documentation: a $tagSYSTEMTIME structure that specifies a local time or a pointer to it. The function converts this time to the corresponding UTC time.

params.label: $tTimeZone
params.documentation: [optional] a $tagTIME_ZONE_INFORMATION structure that specifies the time zone of interest or a pointer to it.If 0, the function uses the currently active time zone.

_DayValueToDate.documentation: Add the given days since noon 4713 BC January 1 and returns the Gregorian date

params.label: $iJulianDate
params.documentation: A valid number of days.

params.label: $iYear
params.documentation: will return the year in format YYYY

params.label: $iMonth
params.documentation: will return the month in format MM

params.label: $iDay
params.documentation: will return the day in format DD

params.label: $iComDebug
params.documentation: [optional] Debug level. Possible values are:-1 - Return the current settings 0 - Disable debugging 1 - Enable debugging. Output the debug info (default)

params.label: $bExit
params.documentation: [optional] True if the script must be terminated

_DebugOut.documentation: Displays output on a debugging session started by _DebugSetup()
_DebugOut.label: _DebugOut ( $sOutput )

params.label: $sOutput
params.documentation: The string (or other printable value) to be output to the debugging session.

params.label: $sData
params.documentation: Data to be reported

params.label: $bLastError
params.documentation: [optional] True if _WinAPI_GetLastErrorMessage() must be append to the data being reported

params.label: $bExit
params.documentation: [optional] True if the script must be terminated

_DebugReportEx.documentation: Writes to a debugging session a formatted message
_DebugReportEx.label: _DebugReportEx ( $sData [, $bLastError = False [, $bExit = False]] )

params.label: $sData
params.documentation: Data to be reported (e.g. "dllname|functionname")

params.label: $bLastError
params.documentation: [optional] True if _WinAPI_GetLastErrorMessage() must be append to the data being reported

params.label: $bExit
params.documentation: [optional] True if the script must be terminated

_DebugReportVar.documentation: Writes to debugging session the content of a variable
_DebugReportVar.label: _DebugReportVar ( $sVarName, $vVar [, $bErrExt = False [, $iDebugLineNumber = @ScriptLineNumber]] )

params.label: $sVarName
params.documentation: string representing name of the variable or a comment

params.label: $vVar
params.documentation: the variable to be reported

params.label: $bErrExt
params.documentation: [optional] True if @error and @extended must also be displayed

params.label: $iDebugLineNumber
params.documentation: [optional] can be used to overwrite the current calling line number. Default = @ScriptLineNumber

_DebugSetup.documentation: Setup up a debug session using a specific reporting type
_DebugSetup.label: _DebugSetup ( [$sTitle = Default [, $bBugReportInfos = False [, $vReportType = 1 [, $sLogFile = "" [, $bTimeStamp = False]]]]] )

params.label: $sTitle
params.documentation: [optional] Title to be displayed on the report window. Default value is "AutoIt Debug Report".

params.label: $bBugReportInfos
params.documentation: [optional] Display BugReport infos. Default value is False.

params.label: $vReportType
params.documentation: [optional] 1 - Report Log Window (Default).2 - ConsoleWrite.3 - MsgBox.4 - FileWrite into $sLogFile defines the filename.5 - Report Notepad Window.string - name of specific report function to be used.

params.label: $sLogFile
params.documentation: [optional] Name of the file if $vReportType = 4

params.label: $bTimeStamp
params.documentation: [optional] True if every message must be prefixed with a timeStamp "YYYY/MM/DD HH:MM:SS"

params.label: $iRadians
params.documentation: Radians to be converted into degrees.

_EventLog__Backup.documentation: Saves the event log to a backup file
_EventLog__Backup.label: _EventLog__Backup ( $hEventLog, $sFileName )

params.label: $hEventLog
params.documentation: Handle to the event log

params.label: $sFileName
params.documentation: The name of the backup file

params.label: $hEventLog
params.documentation: Handle to the event log

params.label: $sFileName
params.documentation: The name of the backup file. If the name is blank, the current event log is not backed up.

_EventLog__Close.documentation: Closes a read handle to the event log
_EventLog__Close.label: _EventLog__Close ( $hEventLog )

params.label: $hEventLog
params.documentation: Handle to the event log

_EventLog__Count.documentation: Retrieves the number of records in the event log
_EventLog__Count.label: _EventLog__Count ( $hEventLog )

params.label: $hEventLog
params.documentation: A handle to the event log

_EventLog__DeregisterSource.documentation: Closes a write handle to the event log
_EventLog__DeregisterSource.label: _EventLog__DeregisterSource ( $hEventLog )

params.label: $hEventLog
params.documentation: A handle to the event log

_EventLog__Full.documentation: Retrieves whether the event log is full
_EventLog__Full.label: _EventLog__Full ( $hEventLog )

params.label: $hEventLog
params.documentation: A handle to the event log

_EventLog__Notify.documentation: Enables an application to receive event notifications
_EventLog__Notify.label: _EventLog__Notify ( $hEventLog, $hEvent )

params.label: $hEventLog
params.documentation: A handle to the event log

params.label: $hEvent
params.documentation: A handle to a manual-reset event object

_EventLog__Oldest.documentation: Retrieves the absolute record number of the oldest record in the event log
_EventLog__Oldest.label: _EventLog__Oldest ( $hEventLog )

params.label: $hEventLog
params.documentation: A handle to the event log

_EventLog__Open.documentation: Opens a handle to the event log
_EventLog__Open.label: _EventLog__Open ( $sServerName, $sSourceName )

params.label: $sServerName
params.documentation: The UNC name of the server on where the event log will be opened. If blank, the operation is performed on the local computer.

params.label: $sSourceName
params.documentation: The name of the log

_EventLog__OpenBackup.documentation: Opens a handle to a backup event log
_EventLog__OpenBackup.label: _EventLog__OpenBackup ( $sServerName, $sFileName )

params.label: $sServerName
params.documentation: The UNC name of the server on where the event log will be opened.If blank, the operation is performed on the local computer.

params.label: $sFileName
params.documentation: The name of the backup file

_EventLog__Read.documentation: Reads an entry from the event log
_EventLog__Read.label: _EventLog__Read ( $hEventLog [, $bRead = True [, $bForward = True [, $iOffset = 0]]] )

params.label: $hEventLog
params.documentation: A handle to the event log

params.label: $bRead
params.documentation: [optional] If True, operation proceeds sequentially from the last call to this function using this handle.If False, the read will operation proceeds from the record specified by the $iOffset parameter.

params.label: $bForward
params.documentation: [optional] If True, the log is read in date order. If False, the log is read in reverse date order.

params.label: $iOffset
params.documentation: [optional] The number of the event record at which the read operation should start.This parameter is ignored if $bRead is True.

_EventLog__RegisterSource.documentation: Retrieves a registered handle to the specified event log
_EventLog__RegisterSource.label: _EventLog__RegisterSource ( $sServerName, $sSourceName )

params.label: $sServerName
params.documentation: The UNC name of the server on where the event log will be opened. If blank, the operation is performed on the local computer.

params.label: $sSourceName
params.documentation: The name of the event source whose handle is to be retrieved. The source name must be a subkey of a log under the Eventlog registry key.

_EventLog__Report.documentation: Writes an entry at the end of the specified event log
_EventLog__Report.label: _EventLog__Report ( $hEventLog, $iType, $iCategory, $iEventID, $sUserName, $sDesc, $aData )

params.label: $hEventLog
params.documentation: A handle to the event log. As of Windows XP SP2, this cannot be a handle to the Security log.

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: Event type. This can be one of the following values:    0 - Success event    1 - Error event    2 - Warning event    4 - Information event    8 - Success audit event    16 - Failue audit event

params.label: $iCategory
params.documentation: The event category. This is source specific information the category can have any value.

params.label: $iEventID
params.documentation: The event identifier. The event identifier specifies the entry in the message file associated with the event source.

params.label: $sUserName
params.documentation: User name for the event. This can be blank to indicate that no name is required.

params.label: $sDesc
params.documentation: Event description

params.label: $aData
params.documentation: Data array formated as follows:    [0] - Number of bytes in array    [1] - Byte 1    [2] - Byte 2    [n] - Byte n

_Excel_BookAttach.documentation: Attaches to the first instance of a workbook where the search string matches based on the selected mode
_Excel_BookAttach.label: _Excel_BookAttach ( $sString [, $sMode = "FilePath" [, $oInstance = Default]] )

params.label: $sString
params.documentation: String to search for

params.label: $sMode
params.documentation: [optional] specifies search mode:    FileName - Name of the open workbook    FilePath - Full path to the open workbook (default)    Title - Title of the Excel window

params.label: $oInstance
params.documentation: [optional] Object of the Excel instance to be searched (default = keyword Default = all instances)

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Workbook object

params.label: $bSave
params.documentation: [optional] If True the workbook will be saved before closing (default = True)

_Excel_BookList.documentation: Returns a list of workbooks of a specified or all Excel instances
_Excel_BookList.label: _Excel_BookList ( [$oExcel = Default] )

params.label: $oExcel
params.documentation: [optional] An Excel application object (default = keyword Default = process all Excel instances)

params.label: $oExcel
params.documentation: Excel application object where you want to create the new workbook

params.label: $iSheets
params.documentation: [optional] Number of sheets to create in the new workbook (default = keyword Default = Excel default value). Maximum is 255

params.label: $oExcel
params.documentation: Excel application object where you want to open the workbook

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Path and filename of the file to be opened

params.label: $bReadOnly
params.documentation: [optional] True opens the workbook as read-only (default = False)

params.label: $bVisible
params.documentation: [optional] True specifies that the workbook window will be visible (default = True)

params.label: $sPassword
params.documentation: [optional] The password that was used to read-protect the workbook, if any (default is none)

params.label: $sWritePassword
params.documentation: [optional] The password that was used to write-protect the workbook, if any (default is none)

params.label: $bUpdateLinks
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the way external references (links) in the file are updated (default = keyword Default) Valid values are: Default: Excel prompts the user to decide how to update links. 0: Excel doesn't update links. 3: Excel updates all links.

_Excel_BookOpenText.documentation: Opens a text file and parses the content to a new workbook with a single sheet
_Excel_BookOpenText.label: _Excel_BookOpenText ( $oExcel, $sFilePath [, $iStartRow = 1 [, $iDataType = Default [, $sTextQualifier = $xlTextQualifierDoubleQuote [, $bConsecutiveDelimiter = False [, $sDelimiter = "," [, $aFieldInfo = "" [, $sDecimalSeparator = Default [, $sThousandsSeparator = Default [, $bTrailingMinusNumbers = True [, $iOrigin = Default]]]]]]]]]] )

params.label: $oExcel
params.documentation: Excel application object where you want to open the new workbook

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Path and filename of the file to be opened

params.label: $iStartRow
params.documentation: [optional] The row at which to start parsing the file (default = 1)

params.label: $iDataType
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the column format of the data in the file. Can be any of the XlTextParsingType enumeration.    If set to keyword Default Excel attempts to determine the column format (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $sTextQualifier
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the text qualifier (default = $xlTextQualifierDoubleQuote)

params.label: $bConsecutiveDelimiter
params.documentation: [optional] True will consider consecutive delimiters as one delimiter (default = False)

params.label: $sDelimiter
params.documentation: [optional] One or multiple characters to be used as delimiter (default = ",")

params.label: $aFieldInfo
params.documentation: [optional] An array containing parse information for individual columns of data.    The interpretation depends on the value of DataType.    When the data is delimited, this argument is an array of two-element arrays, with each two-element array    specifying the conversion options for a particular column.    The first element is the column number (1-based), and the second element is one of the XlColumnDataType    constants specifying how the column is parsed (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $sDecimalSeparator
params.documentation: [optional] Decimal separator that Excel uses when recognizing numbers.    Default setting is the system setting (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $sThousandsSeparator
params.documentation: [optional] Thousands separator that Excel uses when recognizing numbers.    Default setting is the system setting (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $bTrailingMinusNumbers
params.documentation: [optional] True treats numbers with a minus character at the end as negative numbers.    False treats such numbers as text (default = True)

params.label: $iOrigin
params.documentation: [optional] Origin of the text file. Can be one of the XlPlatform constants.    Additionally, this could be an integer representing the code page number of the desired code page.    For example, "1256" would specify that the encoding is Arabic (Windows).    If this argument is omitted, the method uses the current setting of the File Origin option in the Text Import Wizard.

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Object of the workbook to save

_Excel_BookSaveAs.documentation: Saves the specified workbook with a new filename and/or type
_Excel_BookSaveAs.label: _Excel_BookSaveAs ( $oWorkbook, $sFilePath [, $iFormat = $xlWorkbookDefault [, $bOverWrite = False [, $sPassword = Default [, $sWritePassword = Default [, $bReadOnlyRecommended = False]]]]] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Workbook object to be saved

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Path and filename of the file to be read

params.label: $iFormat
params.documentation: [optional] Excel writeable filetype. Can be any value of the XlFileFormat enumeration.

params.label: $bOverWrite
params.documentation: [optional] True overwrites an already existing file (default = False)

params.label: $sPassword
params.documentation: [optional] The string password to protect the sheet with. If set to keyword Default no password will be used (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $sWritePassword
params.documentation: [optional] The string write-access password to protect the sheet with. If set to keyword Default no password will be used (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $bReadOnlyRecommended
params.documentation: [optional] True displays a message when the file is opened, recommending that the file be opened as read-only (default = False)

_Excel_Close.documentation: Closes all worksheets and the instance of the Excel application
_Excel_Close.label: _Excel_Close ( $oExcel [, $bSaveChanges = True [, $bForceClose = False]] )

params.label: $oExcel
params.documentation: Excel application object as returned by _Excel_Open()

params.label: $bSaveChanges
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether changed worksheets should be saved before closing (default = True)

params.label: $bForceClose
params.documentation: [optional] If True the Excel application is closed even when it was not started by _Excel_Open() (default = False)

_Excel_ColumnToLetter.documentation: Converts the column number to letter(s)
_Excel_ColumnToLetter.label: _Excel_ColumnToLetter ( $iColumn )

params.label: $iColumn
params.documentation: The column number which you want to turn into letter(s)

_Excel_ColumnToNumber.documentation: Converts the column letter(s) to a number
_Excel_ColumnToNumber.label: _Excel_ColumnToNumber ( $sColumn )

params.label: $sColumn
params.documentation: The column letter(s) which you want to turn into a number (e.g. "ZZ" to 702)

_Excel_ConvertFormula.documentation: Converts cell references in a formula between A1 and R1C1 reference styles, relative and absolute reference type, or both
_Excel_ConvertFormula.label: _Excel_ConvertFormula ( $oExcel, $sFormula, $iFromStyle [, $iToStyle = Default [, $iToAbsolute = Default [, $vRelativeTo = Default]]] )

params.label: $oExcel
params.documentation: Excel application object

params.label: $sFormula
params.documentation: String containing the formula to convert

params.label: $iFromStyle
params.documentation: The reference style of the formula. Can be any of the XlReferenceStyle enumeration

params.label: $iToStyle
params.documentation: [optional] A XlReferenceStyle enumeration specifying the reference style to be returned. If omitted, the reference style isn't changed

params.label: $iToAbsolute
params.documentation: [optional] A XlReferenceType which specifies the converted reference type. If this argument is omitted, the reference type isn't changed

params.label: $vRelativeTo
params.documentation: [optional] A Range object or a A1 range that contains one cell. Relative references relate to this cell. If omitted A1 is used

_Excel_Export.documentation: Exports a workbook, worksheet, chart or range as PDF or XPS
_Excel_Export.label: _Excel_Export ( $oExcel, $vObject, $sFileName [, $iType = $xlTypePDF [, $iQuality = $xlQualityStandard [, $bIncludeProperties = True [, $iFrom = Default [, $iTo = Default [, $bOpenAfterPublish = Default]]]]]] )

params.label: $oExcel
params.documentation: Excel application object

params.label: $vObject
params.documentation: Workbook, worksheet, chart or range object to export as PDF or XPS. Range can be specified as A1 range too

params.label: $sFileName
params.documentation: Path/name of the exported file

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: [optional] Can be either $xlTypePDF or $xlTypeXPS of the XlFixedFormatType enumeration (default = $xlTypePDF)

params.label: $iQuality
params.documentation: [optional] Can be any of the XlFixedFormatQuality enumeration (default = $xlQualityStandard)

params.label: $bIncludeProperties
params.documentation: [optional] True indicates that document properties should be included (default = True)

params.label: $iFrom
params.documentation: [optional] The page number at which to start publishing (default = keyword Default = start at the beginning)

params.label: $iTo
params.documentation: [optional] The page number at which to end publishing (default = keyword Default = end at the last page)

params.label: $bOpenAfterPublish
params.documentation: [optional] True displays the file in viewer after it is published (default = False)

_Excel_FilterGet.documentation: Returns a list of set filters
_Excel_FilterGet.label: _Excel_FilterGet ( $oWorkbook [, $vWorksheet = Default] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Excel workbook object

params.label: $vWorksheet
params.documentation: [optional] Name, index or worksheet object to be filtered. If set to keyword Default the active sheet will be filtered

_Excel_FilterSet.documentation: Sets/unsets filter definitions and filters the range
_Excel_FilterSet.label: _Excel_FilterSet ( $oWorkbook, $vWorksheet, $vRange, $iField [, $sCriteria1 = Default [, $iOperator = Default [, $sCriteria2 = Default]]] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Excel workbook object

params.label: $vWorksheet
params.documentation: Name, index or worksheet object to be filtered. If set to keyword Default the active sheet will be filtered

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: A range object or an A1 range to specify the columns to filter on.    Use keyword Default to filter on all used columns of the specified worksheet

params.label: $iField
params.documentation: Integer offset of the field on which you want to base the filter (the leftmost field is field one).    If set to 0 all Autofilters on the worksheet will be removed

params.label: $sCriteria1
params.documentation: [optional] The criteria (a string or an array of strings). Use "=" to find blank fields, or use "<>" to find nonblank fields.    If this argument is omitted, the criteria is All.    If Operator is xlTop10Items, Criteria1 specifies the number of items (for example, "10")

params.label: $iOperator
params.documentation: [optional] One of the constants of the XlAutoFilterOperator enumeration specifying the type of filter

params.label: $sCriteria2
params.documentation: [optional] The second criteria (a string). Used with Criteria1 and Operator to construct compound criteria

_Excel_Open.documentation: Connects to an existing Excel instance or creates a new one
_Excel_Open.label: _Excel_Open ( [$bVisible = True [, $bDisplayAlerts = False [, $bScreenUpdating = True [, $bInteractive = True [, $bForceNew = False]]]]] )

params.label: $bVisible
params.documentation: [optional] True specifies that the application will be visible (default = True)

params.label: $bDisplayAlerts
params.documentation: [optional] False suppresses all prompts and alert messages while opening a workbook (default = False)

params.label: $bScreenUpdating
params.documentation: [optional] False suppresses screen updating to speed up your script (default = True)

params.label: $bInteractive
params.documentation: [optional] If False, Excel blocks all keyboard and mouse input by the user (except input to dialog boxes) (default = True)

params.label: $bForceNew
params.documentation: [optional] True forces to create a new Excel instance even if there is already a running instance (default = False)

_Excel_PictureAdd.documentation: Adds a picture on the specified workbook and worksheet
_Excel_PictureAdd.label: _Excel_PictureAdd ( $oWorkbook, $vWorksheet, $sFile, $vRangeOrLeft [, $iTop = Default [, $iWidth = Default [, $iHeight = Default [, $bKeepRatio = True]]]] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Excel workbook object

params.label: $vWorksheet
params.documentation: Name, index or worksheet object to be written to. If set to keyword Default the active sheet will be used

params.label: $sFile
params.documentation: Full path to picture file being added

params.label: $vRangeOrLeft
params.documentation: Either an A1 range, a range object or an integer denoting the left position of the pictures upper left corner

params.label: $iTop
params.documentation: [optional] If $vRangeOrLeft is an integer then $iTop is the top position of the pictures upper left corner.

params.label: $iWidth
params.documentation: [optional] If specified, sets the width of the picture. If not specified, width will adjust automatically (default = Automatic)

params.label: $iHeight
params.documentation: [optional] If specified, sets the height of the picture. If not specified, height will adjust automatically (default = Automatic)

params.label: $bKeepRatio
params.documentation: [optional] Only used if $vRangeOrLeft is a multi-cell range (default = True)    True will maintain image aspect ratio while staying within the bounds of $vRangeOrLeft.    False will fill the $vRangeOrLeft regardless of original aspect ratio.

_Excel_Print.documentation: Prints a workbook, worksheet, chart or range
_Excel_Print.label: _Excel_Print ( $oExcel, $vObject [, $iCopies = Default [, $sPrinter = Default [, $bPreview = Default [, $iFrom = Default [, $iTo = Default [, $bPrintToFile = Default [, $bCollate = Default [, $sPrToFileName = ""]]]]]]]] )

params.label: $oExcel
params.documentation: Excel application object

params.label: $vObject
params.documentation: Workbook, worksheet, chart or range object to print. Range can be specified as A1 range too

params.label: $iCopies
params.documentation: [optional] Number of copies to print (default = keyword Default = 1)

params.label: $sPrinter
params.documentation: [optional] Name of the printer to be used. Defaults to active printer (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $bPreview
params.documentation: [optional] True to invoke print preview before printing (default = keyword Default = False)

params.label: $iFrom
params.documentation: [optional] Page number where to start printing (default = keyword Default = first page)

params.label: $iTo
params.documentation: [optional] Page number where to stop printing (default = keyword Default = last page)

params.label: $bPrintToFile
params.documentation: [optional] True to print to a file. See parameter $sPrToFileName (default = keyword Default = False)

params.label: $bCollate
params.documentation: [optional] True to collate multiple copies (default = keyword Default = False)

params.label: $sPrToFileName
params.documentation: [optional] If $bPrintToFile is set to True, this argument specifies the name of the file you want to print to.

_Excel_RangeCopyPaste.documentation: Cuts or copies one or multiple cells, rows or columns to a range or from/to the clipboard
_Excel_RangeCopyPaste.label: _Excel_RangeCopyPaste ( $oWorksheet, $vSourceRange [, $vTargetRange = Default [, $bCut = False [, $iPaste = Default [, $iOperation = Default [, $bSkipBlanks = False [, $bTranspose = False]]]]]] )

params.label: $oWorksheet
params.documentation: Object of the source worksheet

params.label: $vSourceRange
params.documentation: Source range to copy/cut from. Can be a range object or an A1 range.    If set to keyword Default then the range will be copied from the clipboard.

params.label: $vTargetRange
params.documentation: [optional] Target range to copy/cut to. Can be a range object or an A1 range.    If set to keyword Default then the range will be copied to the clipboard (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $bCut
params.documentation: [optional] If set to True the source range isn't copied but cut out (default = False)    This parameter is ignored when $vSourceRange is set to keyword Default.

params.label: $iPaste
params.documentation: [optional] The part of the range to be pasted from the clipboard (formulas, formats ...). Must be a value of the XlPasteType enumeration    (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $iOperation
params.documentation: [optional] The paste operation (add, divide, multiply ...). Must be a value of the XlPasteSpecialOperation enunmeration    (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $bSkipBlanks
params.documentation: [optional] If set to True blank cells from the clipboard will not be pasted into the target range (default = False)

params.label: $bTranspose
params.documentation: [optional] Set to True to transpose rows and columns when the range is pasted (default = False)

_Excel_RangeDelete.documentation: Deletes one or multiple cells, rows or columns from the specified worksheet
_Excel_RangeDelete.label: _Excel_RangeDelete ( $oWorksheet, $vRange [, $iShift = Default [, $iEntireRowCol = Default]] )

params.label: $oWorksheet
params.documentation: Excel worksheet object

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: Range can be a range object, an A1 range (e.g. "A1:B2", "1:2" (row 1 to 2), "D:G" (columns D to G) etc.

params.label: $iShift
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies which way to shift the cells. Can be xlShiftToLeft or xlShiftUp of the XlDeleteShiftDirection enumeration.    If set to keyword Default, Excel decides based on the shape of the range (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $iEntireRowCol
params.documentation: [optional] If set to 1 the entire row is deleted, if set to 2 the entire column is deleted (default = keyword Default = only delete specified range)

_Excel_RangeFind.documentation: Finds matching cells in a range or workbook and returns an array with information about the found cells
_Excel_RangeFind.label: _Excel_RangeFind ( $oWorkbook, $sSearch [, $vRange = Default [, $iLookIn = $xlValues [, $iLookAt = $xlPart [, $bMatchcase = False]]]] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Workbook object

params.label: $sSearch
params.documentation: Search string. Can be a string (wildcards - *?~ - can be used) or any Excel data type. See Remarks

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: [optional] A range object, an A1 range (string) or keyword Default to search all sheets of the workbook (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $iLookIn
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies where to search. Can be any of the XLFindLookIn enumeration (default = $xlValues)

params.label: $iLookAt
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether the search text must match as a whole or any part. Can be any of the XLLookAt enumeration (default = $xlPart)

params.label: $bMatchcase
params.documentation: [optional] True = case sensitive, False = case insensitive (default = False)

_Excel_RangeInsert.documentation: Inserts one or multiple empty cells, rows or columns into the specified worksheet
_Excel_RangeInsert.label: _Excel_RangeInsert ( $oWorksheet, $vRange [, $iShift = Default [, $iCopyOrigin = Default]] )

params.label: $oWorksheet
params.documentation: Excel worksheet object

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: Range can be a range object, an A1 range (e.g. "A1:B2", "1:2" (row 1 to 2), ""D:G" (columns D to G) etc.

params.label: $iShift
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies which way to shift the cells. Can be xlShiftToRight or xlShiftDown of the XlInsertShiftDirection enumeration.    If set to keyword Default, Excel decides based on the shape of the range (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $iCopyOrigin
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies which formatting option to copy. Can be any of the XlInsertFormatOrigin enumeration (default = keyword Default)

_Excel_RangeLinkAddRemove.documentation: Adds or removes a hyperlink to/from a specified range
_Excel_RangeLinkAddRemove.label: _Excel_RangeLinkAddRemove ( $oWorkbook, $vWorksheet, $vRange, $sAddress [, $sSubAddress = Default [, $sScreenTip = Default [, $sTextToDisplay = Default]]] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Excel workbook object

params.label: $vWorksheet
params.documentation: Name, index or worksheet object to be used. If set to keyword Default the active sheet will be used

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: Either a range object or an A1 range to be set to a hyperlink

params.label: $sAddress
params.documentation: The address for the specified link. The address can be an E-mail address, an Internet    address or a file name. "" removes an existing hyperlink

params.label: $sSubAddress
params.documentation: [optional] The name of a location within the destination file, such as a bookmark, named range    or slide number (default = keyword Default = None)

params.label: $sScreenTip
params.documentation: [optional] The text that appears as a ScreenTip when the mouse pointer is positioned over the    specified hyperlink (default = keyword Default = Uses value of $sAddress)

params.label: $sTextToDisplay
params.documentation: [optional] The text to be displayed for the hyperlink (default = keyword Default = None)

_Excel_RangeRead.documentation: Reads the value, formula or displayed text from a cell or range of cells of the specified workbook and worksheet
_Excel_RangeRead.label: _Excel_RangeRead ( $oWorkbook [, $vWorksheet = Default [, $vRange = Default [, $iReturn = 1 [, $bForceFunc = False]]]] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Excel workbook object

params.label: $vWorksheet
params.documentation: [optional] Name, index or worksheet object to be read. If set to keyword Default the active sheet will be used (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: [optional] Either a range object or an A1 range. If set to Default all used cells will be processed (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $iReturn
params.documentation: [optional] What to return from the specified cell:    1 - Value (default)    2 - Formula    3 - The displayed text    4 - Value2. The only difference between Value and Value2 is that the Value2 property doesn’t use the Currency and Date data types

params.label: $bForceFunc
params.documentation: [optional] True forces to use the _ArrayTranspose function instead of the Excel transpose method (default = False).    See the Remarks section for details.

_Excel_RangeReplace.documentation: Finds and replaces matching strings in a range or worksheet
_Excel_RangeReplace.label: _Excel_RangeReplace ( $oWorkbook, $vWorksheet, $vRange, $sSearch, $sReplace [, $iLookAt = $xlPart [, $bMatchcase = False]] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Excel workbook object

params.label: $vWorksheet
params.documentation: Name, index or worksheet object to be searched. If set to keyword Default the active sheet will be used

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: A range object, an A1 range or keyword Default to search all cells in the specified worksheet

params.label: $sSearch
params.documentation: Search string

params.label: $sReplace
params.documentation: Replace string

params.label: $iLookAt
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether the search text must match as a whole or any part. Can be any of the XLLookAt enumeration (default = $xlPart)

params.label: $bMatchcase
params.documentation: [optional] True = case sensitive, False = case insensitive (default = False)

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Excel workbook object

params.label: $vWorksheet
params.documentation: Name, index or worksheet object to be sorted. If set to keyword Default the active sheet will be used

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: A range object, an A1 range or keyword Default to sort the whole worksheet (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $vKey1
params.documentation: Specifies the first sort field, either as an A1 range or range object

params.label: $iOrder1
params.documentation: [optional] Determines the sort order. Can be any of the XlSortOrder enumeration (default = $xlAscending)

params.label: $iSortText
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies how to sort text in $vKey1, $vKey2 and $vKey3. Can be any of the XlSortDataOption enumeration (default = $xlSortNormal)

params.label: $iHeader
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether the first row contains header information. Can be any of the XlYesNoGuess enumeration (default = $xlNo)

params.label: $bMatchCase
params.documentation: [optional] True to perform a case-sensitive sort, False to perform non-case sensitive sort (default = False)

params.label: $iOrientation
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the sort orientation. Can be any of the XlSortOrientation enumeration (default = $xlSortColumns)

params.label: $vKey2
params.documentation: [optional] See $vKey1

params.label: $iOrder2
params.documentation: [optional] See $iOrder1

params.label: $vKey3
params.documentation: [optional] See $vKey1

params.label: $iOrder3
params.documentation: [optional] See $iOrder1

_Excel_RangeValidate.documentation: Adds data validation to the specified range
_Excel_RangeValidate.label: _Excel_RangeValidate ( $oWorkbook, $vWorksheet, $vRange, $iType, $sFormula1 [, $iOperator = Default [, $sFormula2 = Default [, $bIgnoreBlank = True [, $iAlertStyle = $xlValidAlertStop [, $sErrorMessage = Default [, $sInputMessage = Default]]]]]] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Excel workbook object

params.label: $vWorksheet
params.documentation: Name, index or worksheet object. If set to keyword Default the active sheet will be used

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: A range object, an A1 range or keyword Default to validate all cells in the specified worksheet

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: The validation type. Can be any of the XlDVType enumeration

params.label: $sFormula1
params.documentation: The first part of the data validation equation

params.label: $iOperator
params.documentation: [optional] The data validation operator. Can be any of the XlFormatConditionOperator enumeration (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $sFormula2
params.documentation: [optional] The second part of the data validation when $iOperator is $xlBetween or $xlNotBetween. Otherwise it is ignored (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $bIgnoreBlank
params.documentation: [optional] If set to True, cell data is considered valid if the cell is blank (default = True)

params.label: $iAlertStyle
params.documentation: [optional] The validation alert style. Can be any of the XlDVAlertStyle enumeration (default = $xlValidAlertStop)

params.label: $sErrorMessage
params.documentation: [optional] Message to be displayed in a MsgBox when invalid data has been entered (default = keyword Default)

params.label: $sInputMessage
params.documentation: [optional] Message to be displayed in a Tooltip when you begin to enter data (default = keyword Default)

_Excel_RangeWrite.documentation: Writes value(s) or formula(s) to a cell or a cell range on the specified workbook and worksheet
_Excel_RangeWrite.label: _Excel_RangeWrite ( $oWorkbook, $vWorksheet, $vValue [, $vRange = "A1" [, $bValue = True [, $bForceFunc = False]]] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: Excel workbook object

params.label: $vWorksheet
params.documentation: Name, index or worksheet object to be written to. If set to keyword Default the active sheet will be used

params.label: $vValue
params.documentation: Can be a string, a 1D or 2D zero based array containing the data to be written to the worksheet

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: [optional] Either an A1 range or a range object (default = "A1")

params.label: $bValue
params.documentation: [optional] If True the $vValue will be written to the value property. If False $vValue will be written to the formula property (default = True)

params.label: $bForceFunc
params.documentation: [optional] True forces to use the _ArrayTranspose function instead of the Excel transpose method (default = False).    See the Remarks section for details.

_Excel_SheetAdd.documentation: Adds new sheet(s) to a workbook and sets their names
_Excel_SheetAdd.label: _Excel_SheetAdd ( $oWorkbook [, $vSheet = Default [, $bBefore = True [, $iCount = 1 [, $sName = ""]]]] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: A workbook object

params.label: $vSheet
params.documentation: [optional] Object, index or name of the sheet before/after which the new sheet is inserted.    -1 = insert before/after the last worksheet (default = keyword Default = active worksheet)

params.label: $bBefore
params.documentation: [optional] The new sheet will be inserted before $vSheet if True, after $vSheet if False (default = True)

params.label: $iCount
params.documentation: [optional] Number of worksheets to be inserted (default = 1). Maximum is 255

params.label: $sName
params.documentation: [optional] Name(s) of the sheet(s) to create (default = "" = follows standard Excel new sheet convention).    When $iCount > 1 multiple names can be provided separated by | (pipe character). Sheets are named from left to right

_Excel_SheetCopyMove.documentation: Copies or moves the specified sheet before or after a specified sheet in the same or a different workbook
_Excel_SheetCopyMove.label: _Excel_SheetCopyMove ( $oSourceBook [, $vSourceSheet = Default [, $oTargetBook = $oSourceBook [, $vTargetSheet = 1 [, $bBefore = True [, $bCopy = True]]]]] )

params.label: $oSourceBook
params.documentation: Object of the source workbook where the sheet should be copied/moved from

params.label: $vSourceSheet
params.documentation: [optional] Name, index or object of the sheet to copy/move (default = keyword Default = active sheet)

params.label: $oTargetBook
params.documentation: [optional] Object of the target workbook where the sheet should be copied/moved to (default = keyword Default = $oSourceBook)

params.label: $vTargetSheet
params.documentation: [optional] The copied/moved sheet will be placed before or after this sheet (name, index or object) (default = keyword Default = first sheet)

params.label: $bBefore
params.documentation: [optional] The copied/moved sheet will be placed before $vTargetSheet if True, after it if False (default = True)

params.label: $bCopy
params.documentation: [optional] Copy the specified sheet if True, move the sheet if False (default = True)

_Excel_SheetDelete.documentation: Deletes the specified sheet by object, string name or by number
_Excel_SheetDelete.label: _Excel_SheetDelete ( $oWorkbook [, $vSheet = Default] )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: A workbook object

params.label: $vSheet
params.documentation: [optional] The sheet to delete, either by object, string name or number (default = keyword Default = active Worksheet)

_Excel_SheetList.documentation: Returns a list of all sheets in the specified workbook
_Excel_SheetList.label: _Excel_SheetList ( $oWorkbook )

params.label: $oWorkbook
params.documentation: A workbook object

_FileCountLines.documentation: Returns the number of lines in the specified file
_FileCountLines.label: _FileCountLines ( $sFilePath )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Path and filename of the file to be read

_FileCreate.documentation: Creates or zero's out the length of the file specified
_FileCreate.label: _FileCreate ( $sFilePath )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Path and filename of the file to be created.

_FileListToArray.documentation: Lists files and\or folders in a specified folder (Similar to using Dir with the /B Switch)
_FileListToArray.label: _FileListToArray ( $sFilePath [, $sFilter = "*" [, $iFlag = $FLTA_FILESFOLDERS [, $bReturnPath = False]]] )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Folder to generate filelist for.

params.label: $sFilter
params.documentation: [optional] the filter to use, default is *. (* and ? wildcards accepted - See Remarks)

params.label: $iFlag
params.documentation: [optional] specifies whether to return files folders or both    $FLTA_FILESFOLDERS (0) = (Default) Return both files and folders    $FLTA_FILES (1) = Return files only    $FLTA_FOLDERS (2) = Return Folders only    Constants are defined in FileConstants.au3

params.label: $bReturnPath
params.documentation: [optional] If True the full path is appended to the file\folder path, otherwise it is relative to the $sFilePath folder. Default is False.

_FileListToArrayRec.documentation: Lists files and\or folders in specified path with optional recursion to defined level and result sorting
_FileListToArrayRec.label: _FileListToArrayRec ( $sFilePath [, $sMask = "*" [, $iReturn = $FLTAR_FILESFOLDERS [, $iRecur = $FLTAR_NORECUR [, $iSort = $FLTAR_NOSORT [, $iReturnPath = $FLTAR_RELPATH]]]]] )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Initial path used to generate filelist.If path ends in \ then folders will be returned with an ending \If path lengths > 260 chars, prefix path with "\\?\" - return paths are not affected

params.label: $sMask
params.documentation: [optional] Filter for result. Multiple filters must be separated by ";"Use "|" to separate 3 possible sets of filters: "Include|Exclude|Exclude_Folders"    Include = Files/Folders to include (default = "*" [all])    Exclude = Files/Folders to exclude (default = "" [none])    Exclude_Folders = only used if $iRecur = 1 AND $iReturn <> 2 to exclude defined folders (default = "" [none])

params.label: $iReturn
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether to return files, folders or both and omit those with certain attributes    $FLTAR_FILESFOLDERS (0) - (Default) Return both files and folders    $FLTAR_FILES (1) - Return files only    $FLTAR_FOLDERS (2) - Return Folders onlyAdd one or more of the following to $iReturn to omit files/folders with that attribute    + $FLTAR_NOHIDDEN (4) - Hidden files and folders    + $FLTAR_NOSYSTEM (8) - System files and folders    + $FLTAR_NOLINK (16) - Link/junction folders

params.label: $iRecur
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether to search recursively in subfolders and to what level    $FLTAR_NORECUR (0) - Do not search in subfolders (Default)    $FLTAR_RECUR (1) - Search in all subfolders (unlimited recursion)Negative integer - Search in subfolders to specified depth

params.label: $iSort
params.documentation: [optional] Sort results in alphabetical and depth order    $FLTAR_NOSORT (0) - Not sorted (Default)    $FLTAR_SORT (1) - Sorted    $FLTAR_FASTSORT (2) - Sorted with faster algorithm (assumes files in folder returned sorted - requires NTFS and not guaranteed)

params.label: $iReturnPath
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies displayed path of results    $FLTAR_NOPATH (0) - File/folder name only    $FLTAR_RELPATH (1) - Relative to initial path (Default)    $FLTAR_FULLPATH (2) - Full path included

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: The file to print.

params.label: $iShow
params.documentation: [optional] The state of the window. (default = @SW_HIDE)

_FileReadToArray.documentation: Reads the specified file into a 1D or 2D array
_FileReadToArray.label: _FileReadToArray ( $sFilePath, ByRef $vReturn [, $iFlags = $FRTA_COUNT [, $sDelimiter = ""]] )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Path and filename of the file to be read.

params.label: $vReturn
params.documentation: Variable to hold returned data - does not need to be an array.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] Add multiple values together as required

params.label: $sDelimiter
params.documentation: [optional] Used to further split each line of the file - e.g. reading CSV files into a 2D array

_FileWriteFromArray.documentation: Writes an array to a specified file
_FileWriteFromArray.label: _FileWriteFromArray ( $sFilePath, Const ByRef $aArray [, $iBase = Default [, $iUBound = Default [, $sDelimiter = "|"]]] )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Path of the file to write to, or a file handle returned by FileOpen().

params.label: $aArray
params.documentation: The array to be written to the specified file.

params.label: $iBase
params.documentation: [optional] Start array index to read, normally set to 0 or 1. Default is 0.

params.label: $iUbound
params.documentation: [optional] Set to the last record you want to write to the File. Default is the whole array.

params.label: $sDelimiter
params.documentation: [optional] Delimiter character(s) for 2-dimension arrays. Default is "|".

_FileWriteLog.documentation: Writes current date, time and the specified text to a log file
_FileWriteLog.label: _FileWriteLog ( $sLogPath, $sLogMsg [, $iFlag = -1] )

params.label: $sLogPath
params.documentation: Path of the file to write to, or a file handle returned from FileOpen().

params.label: $sLogMsg
params.documentation: Message to be written to the log file

params.label: $iFlag
params.documentation: [optional] Flag that defines if $sLogMsg will be written to the end of file, or to the beginning.If $iFlag = -1 (default) $sLogMsg will be written to the end of file.Otherwise $sLogMsg will be written to beginning of file.

_FileWriteToLine.documentation: Writes text to a specific line in a file
_FileWriteToLine.label: _FileWriteToLine ( $sFilePath, $iLine, $sText [, $bOverWrite = False] )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: The file to write to

params.label: $iLine
params.documentation: The line number to write to

params.label: $sText
params.documentation: The text to write

params.label: $bOverWrite
params.documentation: [optional]    True - will overwrite the old line    False - (default) will not overwrite

params.label: $hSession
params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Open() or _FTP_Connect()

_FTP_Command.documentation: Sends a command to an FTP server
_FTP_Command.label: _FTP_Command ( $hFTPSession, $sFTPCommand [, $iFlags = $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_ASCII [, $iExpectResponse = 0 [, $iContext = 0]]] )

params.label: $hFTPSession
params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Connect()

params.label: $sFTPCommand
params.documentation: Command string to send to FTP Server

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_ASCII or $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_BINARY

params.label: $iExpectResponse
params.documentation: [optional] Data socket for response in Async mode. See remarks.

params.label: $iContext
params.documentation: [optional] A variable that contains the application-defined value that associates this search with any application data.This is only used if the application has already called _FTP_SetStatusCallback() to set up a status callback function.

params.label: $hInternetSession
params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Open()

params.label: $sServerName
params.documentation: Server name/ip.

params.label: $sUsername
params.documentation: Username.

params.label: $sPassword
params.documentation: Password.

params.label: $iPassive
params.documentation: [optional] Passive mode.

params.label: $iServerPort
params.documentation: [optional] Server port ( 0 is default (21) )

params.label: $iService
params.documentation: [optional] This can be one of the following constant values:    $INTERNET_SERVICE_FTP - FTP service.    $INTERNET_SERVICE_GOPHER - Gopher service. Available only on Windows XP, Windows Server 2003 R2 or earlier.    $INTERNET_SERVICE_HTTP - HTTP service.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] Special flags.    $INTERNET_FLAG_PASSIVE    $INTERNET_FLAG_TRANSFER_ASCII    $INTERNET_FLAG_TRANSFER_BINARY

params.label: $fuContext
params.documentation: [optional] A variable that contains the application-defined value that associates this search with any application data.This is only used if the application has already called _FTP_SetStatusCallback() to set up a status callback function.

params.label: $iInternetStatus
params.documentation: Internet status

_FTP_DirCreate.label: _FTP_DirCreate ( $hFTPSession, $sRemote )

params.label: $hFTPSession

params.label: $sRemote

params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Connect().

params.label: $sRemote

_FTP_DirPutContents.label: _FTP_DirPutContents ( $hFTPSession, $sLocalFolder, $sRemoteFolder, $bRecursivePut [, $iContext = 0] )

params.label: $hFTPSession
params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Connect().

params.label: $sLocalFolder
params.documentation: The local folder i.e. "c:\temp".

params.label: $sRemoteFolder
params.documentation: The remote folder i.e. '/website/home'.

params.label: $bRecursivePut

_FTP_DirSetCurrent.documentation: Set Current Directory on an FTP server
_FTP_DirSetCurrent.label: _FTP_DirSetCurrent ( $hFTPSession, $sRemote )

params.label: $hFTPSession
params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Connect().

params.label: $sRemote

params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_FileOpen()

_FTP_FileDelete.documentation: Delete an file from an FTP server
_FTP_FileDelete.label: _FTP_FileDelete ( $hFTPSession, $sRemoteFile )

params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Connect()

_FTP_FileGet.documentation: Get file from a FTP server
_FTP_FileGet.label: _FTP_FileGet ( $hFTPSession, $sRemoteFile, $sLocalFile [, $bFailIfExists = False [, $iFlagsAndAttributes = 0 [, $iFlags = $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_UNKNOWN [, $iContext = 0]]]] )

params.label: $hFTPSession
params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Connect()

_FTP_FileGetSize.documentation: Gets filesize of a file on the FTP server
_FTP_FileGetSize.label: _FTP_FileGetSize ( $hFTPSession, $sFileName )

params.label: $hFTPSession
params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Connect().

params.label: $sFileName
params.documentation: The file name.

_FTP_FileOpen.documentation: Initiates access to a remote file on an FTP server for reading or writing
_FTP_FileOpen.label: _FTP_FileOpen ( $hConnect, $sFileName [, $iAccess = $GENERIC_READ [, $iFlags = $INTERNET_FLAG_TRANSFER_BINARY [, $iContext = 0]]] )

params.label: $hConnect
params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Connect().

params.label: $sFileName
params.documentation: String of the ftp file to open.

params.label: $iAccess
params.documentation: [optional] The Local attribute (default $GENERIC_READ).

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] Specify the conditions under which the transfers occur. The application should select one transfer type and any of the flags that indicate how the caching of the file will be controlled.The transfer type can be one of the following values:    $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_ASCII - Transfers the file using FTP's ASCII (Type A) transfer method. Control and formatting information is converted to local equivalents.    $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_BINARY - Transfers the file using FTP's Image (Type I) transfer method. The file is transferred exactly as it exists with no changes. This is the default transfer method.    $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_UNKNOWN - Defaults to $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_BINARY.    $INTERNET_FLAG_TRANSFER_ASCII - Transfers the file as ASCII.    $INTERNET_FLAG_TRANSFER_BINARY - Transfers the file as binary.The following values are used to control the caching of the file. The application can use one or more of these values:    $INTERNET_FLAG_HYPERLINK - Forces a reload if there was no Expires time and no LastModified time returned from the server when determining whether to reload the item from the network.    $INTERNET_FLAG_NEED_FILE - Causes a temporary file to be created if the file cannot be cached.    $INTERNET_FLAG_RELOAD - Forces a download of the requested file, object, or directory listing from the origin server, not from the cache.    $INTERNET_FLAG_RESYNCHRONIZE - Reloads HTTP resources if the resource has been modified since the last time it was downloaded. All FTP and Gopher resources are reloaded.

params.label: $iContext
params.documentation: [optional] A variable that contains the application-defined value that associates this search with any application data.This is only used if the application has already called _FTP_SetStatusCallback() to set up a status callback function.

_FTP_FilePut.documentation: Puts an file on an FTP server
_FTP_FilePut.label: _FTP_FilePut ( $hFTPSession, $sLocalFile, $sRemoteFile [, $iFlags = 0 [, $iContext = 0]] )

params.label: $hFTPSession
params.documentation: as returned by _FTP_Connect()

params.label: $sLocalFile
params.documentation: The local file.

params.label: $sRemoteFile
params.documentation: The remote Location for the file.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] Specify the conditions under which the transfers occur. The application should select one transfer type and any of the flags that indicate how the caching of the file will be controlled.The transfer type can be one of the following values:    $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_ASCII - Transfers the file using FTP's ASCII (Type A) transfer method. Control and formatting information is converted to local equivalents.    $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_BINARY - Transfers the file using FTP's Image (Type I) transfer method. The file is transferred exactly as it exists with no changes. This is the default transfer method.    $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_UNKNOWN - Defaults to $FTP_TRANSFER_TYPE_BINARY.    $INTERNET_FLAG_TRANSFER_ASCII - Transfers the file as ASCII.    $INTERNET_FLAG_TRANSFER_BINARY - Transfers the file as binary.The following values are used to control the caching of the file. The application can use one or more of these values:    $INTERNET_FLAG_HYPERLINK - Forces a reload if there was no Expires time and no LastModified time returned from the server when determining whether to reload the item from the network.    $INTERNET_FLAG_NEED_FILE - Causes a temporary file to be created if the file cannot be cached.    $INTERNET_FLAG_RELOAD - Forces a download of the requested file, object, or directory listing from the origin server, not from the cache.    $INTERNET_FLAG_RESYNCHRONIZE - Reloads HTTP resources if the resource has been modified since the last time it was downloaded. All FTP and Gopher resources are reloaded.

params.label: $iContext
params.documentation: [optional] A variable that contains the application-defined value that associates this search with any application data.This is only used if the application has already called _FTP_SetStatusCallback() to set up a status callback function.

params.documentation: [optional] 0 = Both Files and Directories, 1 = Directories, 2 = Files.

params.documentation: Random name. ( like "myftp" )

params.label: $iAccessType
params.documentation: [optional] Set if proxy is used:    $INTERNET_OPEN_TYPE_DIRECT -> no proxy (Default)    $INTERNET_OPEN_TYPE_PRECONFIG -> Retrieves the proxy or direct configuration from the registry.    $INTERNET_OPEN_TYPE_PRECONFIG_WITH_NO_AUTOPROXY -> Retrieves the proxy or direct configuration from the registry and prevents the use of a startup Microsoft JScript or Internet Setup (INS) file.    $INTERNET_OPEN_TYPE_PROXY -> Passes requests to the proxy unless a proxy bypass list is supplied and the name to be resolved bypasses the proxy. Then no proxy is used.

params.label: $sProxyName
params.documentation: [optional] ProxyName.

params.label: $sProxyBypass
params.documentation: [optional] ProxyByPasses's.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional]    $INTERNET_FLAG_ASYNC -> Makes only asynchronous requests on handles descended from the handle returned from this function.    $INTERNET_FLAG_FROM_CACHE -> Does not make network requests. All entities are returned from the cache. If the requested item is not in the cache, a suitable error, such as ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND, is returned.

No alpha component.    $GDIP_PXF32ARGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB and alpha component    $GDIP_PXF32PARGB = 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits for each RGB and alpha component, pre-multiplied    $GDIP_PXF48RGB = 48 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB component    $GDIP_PXF64ARGB = 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB and alpha component    $GDIP_PXF64PARGB = 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits for each RGB and alpha component, pre-multiplied

_GDIPlus_BitmapLockBits.documentation: Locks a portion of a bitmap for reading or writing
_GDIPlus_BitmapLockBits.label: _GDIPlus_BitmapLockBits ( $hBitmap, $iLeft, $iTop, $iWidth, $iHeight [, $iFlags = $GDIP_ILMREAD [, $iFormat = $GDIP_PXF32RGB]] )

params.label: $hBitmap
params.documentation: Handle to a bitmap object

params.label: $iLeft
params.documentation: X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle to lock

params.label: $iTop
params.documentation: Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle to lock

params.label: $iWidth
params.documentation: The width of the rectangle to lock

params.label: $iHeight
params.documentation: The height of the rectangle to lock

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] Set of flags that specify whether the locked portion of the bitmap is available for reading or for writing and whether the caller has already allocated a buffer. Can be a combination of the following:    $GDIP_ILMREAD - A portion of the image is locked for reading    $GDIP_ILMWRITE - A portion of the image is locked for writing    $GDIP_ILMUSERINPUTBUF - The buffer is allocated by the user

params.label: $iFormat
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the format of the pixel data in the temporary buffer. Can be one of the following:    $GDIP_PXF01INDEXED - 1 bpp, indexed    $GDIP_PXF04INDEXED - 4 bpp, indexed    $GDIP_PXF08INDEXED - 8 bpp, indexed    $GDIP_PXF16GRAYSCALE - 16 bpp, grayscale    $GDIP_PXF16RGB555 - 16 bpp; 5 bits for each RGB    $GDIP_PXF16RGB565 - 16 bpp; 5 bits red, 6 bits green, and 5 bits blue    $GDIP_PXF16ARGB1555 - 16 bpp; 1 bit for alpha and 5 bits for each RGB component    $GDIP_PXF24RGB - 24 bpp; 8 bits for each RGB    $GDIP_PXF32RGB - 32 bpp; 8 bits for each RGB. No alpha.    $GDIP_PXF32ARGB - 32 bpp; 8 bits for each RGB and alpha    $GDIP_PXF32PARGB - 32 bpp; 8 bits for each RGB and alpha, pre-multiplied

_GDIPlus_EffectCreate.documentation: Creates an Effect object of the type specified by the guid parameter

params.label: $sEffectGUID
params.documentation: Effect Guid constant that specifies the kind of effect to create.

_GDIPlus_EffectCreateBlur.documentation: Creates a Blur class effect object
_GDIPlus_EffectCreateBlur.label: _GDIPlus_EffectCreateBlur ( [$fRadius = 10.0 [, $bExpandEdge = False]] )

params.label: $fRadius
params.documentation: [optional] Real number that specifies the blur radius (the radius of the Gaussian convolution kernel) in pixels.The radius must be in the range 0.0 through 255.0.

params.label: $bExpandEdge
params.documentation: [optional] Boolean value that specifies whether the bitmap expands by an amount equal to the blur radius.If TRUE, the bitmap expands by an amount equal to the radius so that it can have soft edges.If FALSE, the bitmap remains the same size and the soft edges are clipped.

_GDIPlus_EffectCreateBrightnessContrast.documentation: Creates a BrightnessContrast class effect object
_GDIPlus_EffectCreateBrightnessContrast.label: _GDIPlus_EffectCreateBrightnessContrast ( [$iBrightnessLevel = 0 [, $iContrastLevel = 0]] )

params.label: $iBrightnessLevel
params.documentation: [optional] Integer in the range -255 through 255 that specifies the brightness level.

params.label: $iContrastLevel
params.documentation: [optional] Integer in the range -100 through 100 that specifies the contrast level.

_GDIPlus_EffectCreateColorBalance.documentation: Creates a ColorBalance class effect object
_GDIPlus_EffectCreateColorBalance.label: _GDIPlus_EffectCreateColorBalance ( [$iCyanRed = 0 [, $iMagentaGreen = 0 [, $iYellowBlue = 0]]] )

params.label: $iCyanRed
params.documentation: [optional] Integer in the range -100 through 100 that specifies a change in the amount of red in the image.

params.label: $iMagentaGreen
params.documentation: [optional] Integer in the range -100 through 100 that specifies a change in the amount of green in the image.

params.label: $iYellowBlue
params.documentation: [optional] Integer in the range -100 through 100 that specifies a change in the amount of blue in the image.

_GDIPlus_EffectCreateColorCurve.documentation: Creates a ColorBalance class effect object
_GDIPlus_EffectCreateColorCurve.label: _GDIPlus_EffectCreateColorCurve ( $iAdjustment, $iChannel, $iAdjustValue )

params.label: $iAdjustment
params.documentation: CurveAdjustments constant that specifies the adjustment to be applied ($GDIP_Adjust*).

params.label: $iChannel
params.documentation: CurveChannel constant that specifies the color channel to which the adjustment applies ($GDIP_CurveChannel*).

params.label: $iAdjustValue
params.documentation: Integer that specifies the intensity of the adjustment.The range of acceptable values depends on which adjustment is being applied (see $GDIP_Adjust* constants).

_GDIPlus_EffectCreateColorLUT.documentation: Creates a ColorLUT class effect object
_GDIPlus_EffectCreateColorLUT.label: _GDIPlus_EffectCreateColorLUT ( $aColorLUT )

params.label: $aColorLUT
params.documentation: An array[256][4] of a color lookup table for the color channels, alpha, red, green, and blue:    [0][0] - first adjustment value for the alpha channel    [0][1] - first adjustment value for the red channel    [0][2] - first adjustment value for the green channel    [0][3] - first adjustment value for the blue channel    [1][0] - second adjustment value for the alpha channel    [1][1] - second adjustment value for the red channel    [1][2] - second adjustment value for the green channel    [1][3] - second adjustment value for the blue channel    ...    255][0] - last adjustment value for the alpha channel    [255][1] - last adjustment value for the red channel    [255][2] - last adjustment value for the green channel    [255][3] - last adjustment value for the blue channel

params.label: $iShadow
params.documentation: [optional] Integer in the range 0 through 100 that specifies which pixels should be darkened.

_GDIPlus_EffectCreateRedEyeCorrection.documentation: Creates a RedEyeCorrection class effect object

params.label: $aAreas
params.documentation: An array of areas of the bitmap to which red eye correction should be applied:    [0][0] - Number of Area rectangles    [1][0] - X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the first rectangle    [1][1] - Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the first rectangle    [1][2] - Width of the first rectangle    [1][3] - Height of the first rectangle    ...    [n][0] - X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the nth rectangle    [n][1] - Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the nth rectangle    [n][2] - Width of the nth rectangle    [n][3] - Height of the nth rectangle

_GDIPlus_EffectCreateSharpen.documentation: Creates a Sharpen class effect object

params.documentation: [optional] Real number in the range 0.0 through 100.0 that specifies the amount of sharpening to be applied

Can be one or more of the following:    0x0001 - Specifies that reading order is right to left    0x0002 - Specifies that individual lines of text are drawn vertically on the display device    0x0004 - Specifies that parts of characters are allowed to overhang the string's layout rectangle    0x0020 - Specifies that Unicode layout control characters are displayed with a representative character    0x0400 - Specifies that an alternate font is used for characters that are not supported in the requested font    0x0800 - Specifies that the space at the end of each line is included in a string measurement    0x1000 - Specifies that the wrapping of text to the next line is disabled    0x2000 - Specifies that only entire lines are laid out in the layout rectangle    0x4000 - Specifies that characters overhanging the layout rectangle and text extending outside the layout rectangle are allowed to show

params.documentation: Compositing quality:    0 - Gamma correction is not applied.    1 - Gamma correction is not applied. High speed, low quality.    2 - Gamma correction is applied. Composition of high quality and speed.    3 - Gamma correction is applied.    4 - Gamma correction is not applied. Linear values are used.

_GDIPlus_GraphicsSetInterpolationMode.documentation: Sets the interpolation mode of a Graphics object

No prefiltering is done    4 - Bicubic interpolation. No prefiltering is done    5 - Nearest-neighbor interpolation    6 - High-quality, bilinear interpolation. Prefiltering is performed to ensure high-quality shrinking    7 - High-quality, bicubic interpolation. Prefiltering is performed to ensure high-quality shrinking

This results in better performance at the    3 - Character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap and hinting. This results in much better quality    4 - Character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap and no hinting. Stem width differences may be    5 - Character is drawn using its glyph Microsoft ClearType bitmap and hinting. This type of text rendering
