_WinAPI_CreateObjectID.documentation: Creates or retrieves the object identifier for the specified file or directory
_WinAPI_CreateObjectID.label: _WinAPI_CreateObjectID ( $sFilePath )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Path to the file or directory to create or retrieve object identifier.

_WinAPI_CreatePen.documentation: Creates a logical pen that has the specified style, width, and color
_WinAPI_CreatePen.label: _WinAPI_CreatePen ( $iPenStyle, $iWidth, $iColor )

params.label: $iPenStyle
params.documentation: Specifies the pen style. It can be any one of the following values.PS_SOLID - The pen is solid.PS_DASH - The pen is dashed. This style is valid only when the pen width is one or less in device units.PS_DOT - The pen is dotted. This style is valid only when the pen width is one or less in device units.PS_DASHDOT - The pen has alternating dashes and dots. This style is valid only when the pen width is one or less in device units.PS_DASHDOTDOT - The pen has alternating dashes and double dots. This style is valid only when the pen width is one or less in device units.PS_NULL - The pen is invisible.PS_INSIDEFRAME - The pen is solid. When this pen is used in any GDI drawing function that takes a bounding rectangle, the dimensions of the figure are shrunk so that it fits entirely in the bounding rectangle, taking into account the width of the pen. This applies only to geometric pens.

params.label: $iWidth
params.documentation: Specifies the width of the pen, in logical units.

params.label: $iColor
params.documentation: Specifies the color of the pen (BGR)

_WinAPI_CreatePoint.documentation: Creates $tagPOINT structure with the x- and y-coordinates of the specified point
_WinAPI_CreatePoint.label: _WinAPI_CreatePoint ( $iX, $iY )

params.label: $iX
params.documentation: The x-coordinate of the point.

params.label: $iY
params.documentation: The y-coordinate of the point.

params.label: $aPoint
params.documentation: The 2D array ([x1, y1], [x2, y2], ... [xN, yN]) that contains the vertices of the polygon in logical units.The polygon is presumed closed. Each vertex can be specified only once.

params.label: $iStart
params.documentation: [optional] The index of array to start creating at.

params.label: $iEnd
params.documentation: [optional] The index of array to stop creating at.

params.label: $iMode
params.documentation: [optional] The fill mode used to determine which pixels are in the region. This parameter can be one of the following values:    $ALTERNATE (Default)    $WINDING

_WinAPI_CreateProcess.documentation: Creates a new process and its primary thread
_WinAPI_CreateProcess.label: _WinAPI_CreateProcess ( $sAppName, $sCommand, $tSecurity, $tThread, $bInherit, $iFlags, $pEnviron, $sDir, $tStartupInfo, $tProcess )

params.label: $sAppName
params.documentation: The name of the module to be executed

params.label: $sCommand
params.documentation: The command line to be executed

params.label: $tSecurity
params.documentation: a $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure or a pointer to it that determines whether the returned handle to the new process can be inherited by child processes.

params.label: $tThread
params.documentation: a $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure or a pointer to it that determines whether the returned handle to the new thread can be inherited by child processes.

params.label: $bInherit
params.documentation: If True, each inheritable handle in the calling process is inherited by the new process

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: Flags that control the priority class and creation of the process

params.label: $pEnviron
params.documentation: Pointer to the environment block for the new process

params.label: $sDir
params.documentation: The full path to the current directory for the process

params.label: $tStartupInfo
params.documentation: a $tagSTARTUPINFO structure or a pointer to it

params.label: $tProcess
params.documentation: a $tagPROCESS_INFORMATION structure or a pointer to it

_WinAPI_CreateProcessWithToken.documentation: Creates a new process and its primary thread in the security context of the specified token
_WinAPI_CreateProcessWithToken.label: _WinAPI_CreateProcessWithToken ( $sApp, $sCmd, $iFlags, $tStartupInfo, $tProcessInfo, $hToken [, $iLogon = 0 [, $pEnvironment = 0 [, $sDir = '']]] )

params.label: $sApp
params.documentation: The name of the module to be executed. If this parameter is an empty string, the module name must be the first white space–delimited token in the command line string.

params.label: $sCmd
params.documentation: The command line to be executed. If this parameter is an empty string, the function uses the module name as the command line.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: The flags that control how the process is created.The $CREATE_DEFAULT_ERROR_MODE, $CREATE_NEW_CONSOLE, and $CREATE_NEW_PROCESS_GROUP are enabled by default.You can specify additional flags as noted:    $CREATE_DEFAULT_ERROR_MODE    $CREATE_NEW_CONSOLE    $CREATE_NEW_PROCESS_GROUP    $CREATE_SEPARATE_WOW_VDM    $CREATE_SUSPENDED    $CREATE_UNICODE_ENVIRONMENT

params.label: $tStartupInfo
params.documentation: a $tagSTARTUPINFO structure or a pointer to it.

params.label: $tProcessInfo
params.documentation: a $tagPROCESS_INFORMATION structure or a pointer to it that receives information for the new process, including a handle to the process.

params.label: $hToken
params.documentation: A handle to the primary token that represents a user. The handle must have the $TOKEN_QUERY, $TOKEN_DUPLICATE, and $TOKEN_ASSIGN_PRIMARY access rights.

params.label: $iLogon
params.documentation: [optional] The logon option. This parameter can be zero or one of the following values:    $LOGON_WITH_PROFILE    $LOGON_NETCREDENTIALS_ONLY

params.label: $pEnvironment
params.documentation: [optional] A pointer to an environment block for the new process.

params.label: $sDir
params.documentation: [optional] The path to the current directory for the process.If this parameter is an empty string (Default), the new process will have the same current drive and directory as the calling process.

_WinAPI_CreateRect.documentation: Creates $tagRECT structure with the coordinates of the specified rectangle
_WinAPI_CreateRect.label: _WinAPI_CreateRect ( $iLeft, $iTop, $iRight, $iBottom )

params.label: $iLeft
params.documentation: The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.

params.label: $iTop
params.documentation: The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.

params.label: $iRight
params.documentation: The x-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.

params.label: $iBottom
params.documentation: The y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.

_WinAPI_CreateRectEx.documentation: Creates $tagRECT structure with the coordinates of the specified rectangle
_WinAPI_CreateRectEx.label: _WinAPI_CreateRectEx ( $iX, $iY, $iWidth, $iHeight )

params.label: $iX
params.documentation: The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.

params.label: $iY
params.documentation: The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.

params.label: $iWidth
params.documentation: The width of the rectangle.

params.label: $iHeight
params.documentation: The height of the rectangle.

params.label: $iLeftRect
params.documentation: X-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region

params.label: $iTopRect
params.documentation: Y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region

params.label: $iRightRect
params.documentation: X-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the region

params.label: $iBottomRect
params.documentation: Y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the region

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure that contains the coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of the rectangle that defines the region in logical units.

_WinAPI_CreateRoundRectRgn.documentation: Creates a rectangular region with rounded corners
_WinAPI_CreateRoundRectRgn.label: _WinAPI_CreateRoundRectRgn ( $iLeftRect, $iTopRect, $iRightRect, $iBottomRect, $iWidthEllipse, $iHeightEllipse )

params.label: $iLeftRect
params.documentation: X-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region

params.label: $iTopRect
params.documentation: Y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region

params.label: $iRightRect
params.documentation: X-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the region

params.label: $iBottomRect
params.documentation: Y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the region

params.label: $iWidthEllipse
params.documentation: Width of the ellipse used to create the rounded corners

params.label: $iHeightEllipse
params.documentation: Height of the ellipse used to create the rounded corners

_WinAPI_CreateSemaphore.documentation: Creates or opens a named or unnamed semaphore object
_WinAPI_CreateSemaphore.label: _WinAPI_CreateSemaphore ( $sSemaphore, $iInitial, $iMaximum [, $tSecurity = 0] )

params.label: $sSemaphore
params.documentation: The name of the semaphore to be opened. Name comparisons are case sensitive.

params.label: $iInitial
params.documentation: The initial count for the semaphore object. This value must be greater than or equal to zero and less than or equal to $iMaximum.

params.label: $iMaximum
params.documentation: The maximum count for the semaphore object. This value must be greater than zero.

params.label: $tSecurity
params.documentation: [optional] $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new semaphore.If this parameter is 0 (Default), the semaphore gets a default security descriptor.

_WinAPI_CreateSize.documentation: Creates $tagSIZE structure with the width and height of the specified rectangle
_WinAPI_CreateSize.label: _WinAPI_CreateSize ( $iWidth, $iHeight )

params.label: $iWidth
params.documentation: The width of the rectangle.

params.label: $iHeight
params.documentation: The height of the rectangle.

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window where the bitmap will be displayed

params.label: $iColor
params.documentation: The color of the bitmap, stated in RGB

params.label: $iWidth
params.documentation: The width of the bitmap

params.label: $iHeight
params.documentation: The height of the bitmap

params.label: $bRGB
params.documentation: [optional] If True converts to COLOREF (0x00bbggrr)

_WinAPI_CreateSolidBrush.documentation: Creates a logical brush that has the specified solid color
_WinAPI_CreateSolidBrush.label: _WinAPI_CreateSolidBrush ( $iColor )

params.label: $iColor
params.documentation: Specifies the color of the brush

_WinAPI_CreateStreamOnHGlobal.documentation: Creates a stream object that uses a memory handle to store the stream contents
_WinAPI_CreateStreamOnHGlobal.label: _WinAPI_CreateStreamOnHGlobal ( [$hGlobal = 0 [, $bDeleteOnRelease = True]] )

params.label: $hGlobal
params.documentation: [optional] The memory handle, or if 0 (Default) a new handle is to be allocated instead. The handle must be allocated as moveable and nondiscardable.

params.label: $bDeleteOnRelease
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether the underlying handle for this stream object should be automatically freed when the stream object is released, valid values:    True - The final release will automatically free the $hGlobal parameter (Default).    False - The user must free the $hGlobal after the final release.

_WinAPI_CreateString.documentation: Copies a specified string to the newly allocated memory block and returns its pointer
_WinAPI_CreateString.label: _WinAPI_CreateString ( $sString [, $pString = 0 [, $iLength = -1 [, $bUnicode = True [, $bAbort = True]]]] )

params.label: $sString
params.documentation: The source string to be copied.

params.label: $pString
params.documentation: [optional] A pointer to the existing string that to be replaced by a new string.If this parameter is a valid string pointer, the memory will be reallocated for a new string.However, the new memory is allocated at a different location. Therefore, you should always use the pointer that returns this function.If this parameter is 0 (Default) or invalid string pointer, the function just allocates a new memory.

params.label: $iLength
params.documentation: [optional] The required buffer length, in TCHARs, without null-terminating character.If this parameter is (-1), the buffer length will be equal to the length of the source string.If $iLength is less than a source string, the string will be truncated to the specified length. Default is 1.

params.label: $bUnicode
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether a string is Unicode or ASCII code of a character, valid values:    True - Unicode (Default).    False - ASCII.

params.label: $bAbort
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether to exit the script if not enough memory, valid values:    True - Displaying an error message and exit the script with error code 1 (Default).    False - Continue the script and return an error.

params.label: $sSymlink
params.documentation: The name of the new file.

params.label: $sTarget
params.documentation: The name of the existing file.

params.label: $bDirectory
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether the link target is a directory.    True - The link target is a directory.    False - The link target is a file (Default).

_WinAPI_CreateTransform.documentation: Creates $tagXFORM structure specifies a world-space to page-space transformation
_WinAPI_CreateTransform.label: _WinAPI_CreateTransform ( [$nM11 = 1 [, $nM12 = 0 [, $nM21 = 0 [, $nM22 = 1 [, $nDX = 0 [, $nDY = 0]]]]]] )

params.label: $nM11
params.documentation: [optional] The following.Rotation - Cosine of rotation angle.Scaling - Horizontal scaling component.Shear - Not used. Reflection - Horizontal component.

params.label: $nM12
params.documentation: [optional] The following.Rotation - Sine of the rotation angle.Scaling - Not used. Shear - Horizontal proportionality constant.Reflection - Not used.

params.label: $nM21
params.documentation: [optional] The following.Rotation - Negative sine of the rotation angle.Scaling - Not used. Shear - Vertical proportionality constant.Reflection - Not used.

params.label: $nM22
params.documentation: [optional] The following.Rotation - Cosine of rotation angle.Scaling - Vertical scaling component.Shear - Not used.Reflection - Vertical reflection component.

params.label: $nDx
params.documentation: [optional] The horizontal translation component, in logical units. Default is 0.

params.label: $nDy
params.documentation: [optional] The vertical translation component, in logical units. Default is 0.

_WinAPI_CreateWindowEx.documentation: Creates an overlapped, pop-up, or child window
_WinAPI_CreateWindowEx.label: _WinAPI_CreateWindowEx ( $iExStyle, $sClass, $sName, $iStyle, $iX, $iY, $iWidth, $iHeight, $hParent [, $hMenu = 0 [, $hInstance = 0 [, $pParam = 0]]] )

params.label: $iExStyle
params.documentation: Extended window style

params.label: $sClass
params.documentation: Registered class name

params.label: $sName
params.documentation: Window name

params.label: $iStyle
params.documentation: Window style

params.label: $iX
params.documentation: Horizontal position of window

params.label: $iY
params.documentation: Vertical position of window

params.label: $iWidth
params.documentation: Window width

params.label: $iHeight
params.documentation: Window height

params.label: $hParent
params.documentation: Handle to parent or owner window

params.label: $hMenu
params.documentation: [optional] Handle to menu or child-window identifier

params.label: $hInstance
params.documentation: [optional] Handle to application instance

params.label: $pParam
params.documentation: [optional] Pointer to window-creation data

_WinAPI_CreateWindowStation.documentation: Creates a window station object, associates it with the calling process, and assigns it to the current session
_WinAPI_CreateWindowStation.label: _WinAPI_CreateWindowStation ( [$sName = '' [, $iAccess = 0 [, $iFlags = 0 [, $tSecurity = 0]]]] )

params.label: $sName
params.documentation: [optional] The name of the window station to be created. Window station names are case-insensitive and cannot contain backslash characters (\).Only members of the Administrators group are allowed to specify a name.If this parameter is empty string (Default), the system forms a window station name using the logon session identifier for the calling process.

params.label: $iAccess
params.documentation: [optional] The type of access the returned handle has to the window station. This parameter can be one or more of the following values:    $WINSTA_ALL_ACCESS    $WINSTA_ACCESSCLIPBOARD    $WINSTA_ACCESSGLOBALATOMS    $WINSTA_CREATEDESKTOP    $WINSTA_ENUMDESKTOPS    $WINSTA_ENUMERATE    $WINSTA_EXITWINDOWS    $WINSTA_READATTRIBUTES    $WINSTA_READSCREEN    $WINSTA_WRITEATTRIBUTES

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] The optional flags. It can be zero (Default) or the following value:    $CWF_CREATE_ONLY

params.label: $tSecurity
params.documentation: [optional] $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that determines whether the returned handle can be inherited by child processes. If this parameter is 0 (Default), the handle cannot be inherited.

params.label: $pUncompressedBuffer
params.documentation: A pointer to a caller-allocated buffer that receives the decompressed data from compressed buffer.

params.label: $iUncompressedSize
params.documentation: The size of the uncompressed buffer, in bytes.

params.label: $pCompressedBuffer
params.documentation: A pointer to the buffer that contains the data to decompress.

params.label: $iCompressedSize
params.documentation: The size of the compressed buffer, in bytes.

params.label: $iFormat
params.documentation: [optional] The compression format of the data in compressed buffer. This parameter must be one of the following values:    $COMPRESSION_FORMAT_LZNT1 (Default)    $COMPRESSION_FORMAT_XPRESS    $COMPRESSION_FORMAT_XPRESS_HUFF

_WinAPI_DecryptFile.documentation: Decrypts an encrypted file or directory
_WinAPI_DecryptFile.label: _WinAPI_DecryptFile ( $sFilePath )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: The name of the file or directory to be decrypted. If $sFilePath specifies a read-only file, the function fails and the last error code is ERROR_FILE_READ_ONLY (6009). If $sFilePath specifies a directory that contains a read-only file, the functions succeeds but the directory is not decrypted.

_WinAPI_DeferWindowPos.documentation: Updates the specified multiple-window-position structure for the specified window
_WinAPI_DeferWindowPos.label: _WinAPI_DeferWindowPos ( $hInfo, $hWnd, $hAfter, $iX, $iY, $iWidth, $iHeight, $iFlags )

params.label: $hInfo
params.documentation: Handle to a multiple-window-position structure that contains size and position information for one or more windows. This structure is returned by _WinAPI_BeginDeferWindowPos() or by the most recent call to _WinAPI_DeferWindowPos().

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window for which update information is stored in the structure.All windows in a multiple-window-position structure must have the same parent.

params.label: $hAfter
params.documentation: Handle to the window that precedes the positioned window in the Z order.This parameter must be a window handle or one of the following values. This parameter is ignored if the $SWP_NOZORDER flag is set in the $iFlags parameter.    $HWND_BOTTOM    $HWND_NOTOPMOST    $HWND_TOP    $HWND_TOPMOST

params.label: $iX
params.documentation: The x-coordinate of the window's upper-left corner.

params.label: $iY
params.documentation: The y-coordinate of the window's upper-left corner.

params.label: $iWidth
params.documentation: The window's new width, in pixels.

params.label: $iHeight
params.documentation: The window's new height, in pixels.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: A combination of the following values that affect the size and position of the window.    $SWP_DRAWFRAME    $SWP_FRAMECHANGED    $SWP_HIDEWINDOW    $SWP_NOACTIVATE    $SWP_NOCOPYBITS    $SWP_NOMOVE    $SWP_NOOWNERZORDER    $SWP_NOREDRAW    $SWP_NOREPOSITION    $SWP_NOSENDCHANGING    $SWP_NOSIZE    $SWP_NOZORDER    $SWP_SHOWWINDOW

_WinAPI_DefineDosDevice.documentation: Defines, redefines, or deletes MS-DOS device names
_WinAPI_DefineDosDevice.label: _WinAPI_DefineDosDevice ( $sDevice, $iFlags [, $sFilePath = ''] )

params.label: $sDevice
params.documentation: The name of the MS-DOS device.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.$DDD_EXACT_MATCH_ON_REMOVE$DDD_NO_BROADCAST_SYSTEM$DDD_RAW_TARGET_PATH$DDD_REMOVE_DEFINITION

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: [optional] The path that will implement device.

_WinAPI_DefRawInputProc.documentation: Calls the default raw input procedure to process the raw input messages that an application does not process
_WinAPI_DefRawInputProc.label: _WinAPI_DefRawInputProc ( $paRawInput, $iInput )

params.label: $paRawInput
params.documentation: A pointer to an array of $tagRAWINPUT structures that is returned by _WinAPI_GetRawInputBuffer().

params.label: $iInput
params.documentation: The number of structures in array.

_WinAPI_DefSubclassProc.documentation: Calls the next handler in a window's subclass chain
_WinAPI_DefSubclassProc.label: _WinAPI_DefSubclassProc ( $hWnd, $iMsg, $wParam, $lParam )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window being subclassed.

params.label: $iMsg
params.documentation: The message to be sent.

params.label: $wParam
params.documentation: The message-specific information.

params.label: $lParam
params.documentation: The message-specific information.

_WinAPI_DefWindowProc.documentation: Call the default window procedure to provide default processing
_WinAPI_DefWindowProc.label: _WinAPI_DefWindowProc ( $hWnd, $iMsg, $wParam, $lParam )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window procedure that received the message

params.label: $iMsg
params.documentation: Specifies the message

params.label: $wParam
params.documentation: Specifies additional message information

params.label: $lParam
params.documentation: Specifies additional message information

_WinAPI_DefWindowProcW.documentation: Calls the default window procedure to provide default processing for any window messages
_WinAPI_DefWindowProcW.label: _WinAPI_DefWindowProcW ( $hWnd, $iMsg, $wParam, $lParam )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: A handle to the window procedure that received the message.

params.label: $iMsg
params.documentation: The message.

params.label: $wParam
params.documentation: Additional message-specific information. The content of this parameter depends on the message.

params.label: $lParam
params.documentation: Additional message-specific information. The content of this parameter depends on the message.

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Identifies the device context to be deleted

_WinAPI_DeleteEnhMetaFile.documentation: Deletes an enhanced-format metafile or an enhanced-format metafile handle
_WinAPI_DeleteEnhMetaFile.label: _WinAPI_DeleteEnhMetaFile ( $hEmf )

params.label: $hEmf
params.documentation: Handle to an enhanced metafile.

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: The name of the file to be deleted.

_WinAPI_DeleteObject.documentation: Deletes a logical pen, brush, font, bitmap, region, or palette
_WinAPI_DeleteObject.label: _WinAPI_DeleteObject ( $hObject )

params.label: $hObject
params.documentation: Identifies a logical pen, brush, font, bitmap, region, or palette

_WinAPI_DeleteObjectID.documentation: Removes the object identifier from a specified file or directory
_WinAPI_DeleteObjectID.label: _WinAPI_DeleteObjectID ( $sFilePath )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: Path to the file or directory from the object identifier that is to be deleted.

_WinAPI_DeleteVolumeMountPoint.documentation: Deletes a drive letter or mounted folder
_WinAPI_DeleteVolumeMountPoint.label: _WinAPI_DeleteVolumeMountPoint ( $sMountedPath )

params.label: $sMountedPath
params.documentation: The drive letter or mounted folder to be deleted (for example, X:\ or Y:\MountX\).

_WinAPI_DeregisterShellHookWindow.documentation: Unregisters a specified Shell window that is registered to receive Shell hook messages
_WinAPI_DeregisterShellHookWindow.label: _WinAPI_DeregisterShellHookWindow ( $hWnd )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window to unregister from receiving Shell hook messages.

_WinAPI_DestroyCaret.documentation: Destroys the caret's current shape, frees the caret from the window, and removes the caret from the screen
_WinAPI_DestroyCaret.label: _WinAPI_DestroyCaret (  )

_WinAPI_DestroyCursor.documentation: Destroys a cursor and frees any memory the cursor occupied
_WinAPI_DestroyCursor.label: _WinAPI_DestroyCursor ( $hCursor )

params.label: $hCursor
params.documentation: Handle to the cursor to be destroyed. The cursor must not be in use.

_WinAPI_DestroyIcon.documentation: Destroys an icon and frees any memory the icon occupied
_WinAPI_DestroyIcon.label: _WinAPI_DestroyIcon ( $hIcon )

params.label: $hIcon
params.documentation: Handle to the icon to be destroyed. The icon must not be in use.

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window to be destroyed

_WinAPI_DeviceIoControl.documentation: Sends a control code directly to a specified device driver
_WinAPI_DeviceIoControl.label: _WinAPI_DeviceIoControl ( $hDevice, $iControlCode [, $pInBuffer = 0 [, $iInBufferSize = 0 [, $pOutBuffer = 0 [, $iOutBufferSize = 0]]]] )

params.label: $hDevice
params.documentation: Handle to the device on which the operation is to be performed.The device is typically a volume, directory, file, or stream. To retrieve a device handle, use the _WinAPI_CreateFileEx() function.To specify a device name, use the following format:    _WinAPI_CreateFileEx("\\.\DeviceName", ...)

params.label: $iControlCode
params.documentation: The control code for the operation.This value identifies the specific operation to be performed and the type of device on which to perform it.

params.label: $pInBuffer
params.documentation: [optional] A pointer to the input buffer that contains the data required to perform the operation.

params.label: $iInBufferSize
params.documentation: [optional] The size of the input buffer, in bytes. Default is 0.

params.label: $pOutBuffer
params.documentation: [optional] A pointer to the output buffer that is to receive the data returned by the operation.

params.label: $iOutBufferSize
params.documentation: [optional] The size of the output buffer, in bytes. Default is 0.

_WinAPI_DisplayStruct.documentation: Displays data from the specified structure or memory address as a list
_WinAPI_DisplayStruct.label: _WinAPI_DisplayStruct ( $tStruct [, $sStruct = '' [, $sTitle = '' [, $iItem = 0 [, $iSubItem = 0 [, $iFlags = 0 [, $bTop = True [, $hParent = 0]]]]]]] )

params.label: $tStruct
params.documentation: A structure that was created by DllStructCreate(), or memory address to be display its data.

params.label: $sStruct
params.documentation: [optional] A string representing the structure.If $tStruct is a structure, this parameter can be omitted or be an empty string. In this case, the structure will display as "byte[n]" structure.If $tStruct is a memory address, $sStruct should be a string representing the structure, otherwise, the function fail, and @error set to 10.

params.label: $sTitle
params.documentation: [optional] The title of the window, deault is "Structure: ListView Display".

params.label: $iItem
params.documentation: [optional] The 1-based index or name of the structure member to be selected in the list.If this parameter is 0 (Default), or an incorrect index or name, the first element of the structure will be selected.

params.label: $iSubItem
params.documentation: [optional] The 1-based index of the array in the structure member pointed to by the $iItem parameter to be selected.If $iItem was not defined as an array in the $sStruct, or invalid array index, the element pointed to by the $iItem parameter will be selected.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] A set of bit flags that specifies an additional displaying options.This parameter can be 0, or any combination of the following values:    1 - Prevent displaying "" and "" fields at the beginning and end of the list.    2 - Prevent displaying "" fields.    4 - Prevent displaying "" in "Member" column of the list if the structure element has no name.    8 - Prevent highlighting structure elements that are defined as an array.    16 - Prevent perceiving structure elements named "Reserved*" as unused elements.    32 - Prevent using double-click to copy values of the structure elements to the clipboard.    64 - Forced to expand structure elements of BYTE[n] and BOOLEAN[n] types (elements of CHAR[n] and WCHAR[n] types always displays as a string).    128 - Forced to display the values of the structure elements in the hexadecimal representation, if possible.    256 - Forced to return error code instead of displaying a message box if a memory access error occurred.    512 - Forced to disable checking the read access memory allocated to a given structure.

params.label: $bTop
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether create a window with "Always On Top" attribute, valid values:    True - The window is created with the $WS_EX_TOPMOST extended style (Default).    False - The window will not have the "TOPMOST" flag set.

params.label: $hParent
params.documentation: [optional] Handle to the parent window.

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: The path to the DLL file from which information is retrieved.

_WinAPI_DllInstall.documentation: Registers OLE controls such as DLL or ActiveX Controls (OCX) files
_WinAPI_DllInstall.label: _WinAPI_DllInstall ( $sFilePath )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: The path to the DLL file that will be registered.

_WinAPI_DllUninstall.documentation: Unregisters OLE controls such as DLL or ActiveX Controls (OCX) files
_WinAPI_DllUninstall.label: _WinAPI_DllUninstall ( $sFilePath )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: The path to the DLL file that will be unregistered.

_WinAPI_DPtoLP.documentation: Converts device coordinates into logical coordinates
_WinAPI_DPtoLP.label: _WinAPI_DPtoLP ( $hDC, ByRef $tPOINT [, $iCount = 1] )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context.

params.label: $tPOINT
params.documentation: $tagPOINT structure or structure of points ("long x1;long y1;...long xN;long yN") containing the x- and y-coordinates to be transformed.

params.label: $iCount
params.documentation: [optional] The number of points. Default is 1.

_WinAPI_DragAcceptFiles.documentation: Registers whether a window accepts dropped files
_WinAPI_DragAcceptFiles.label: _WinAPI_DragAcceptFiles ( $hWnd [, $bAccept = True] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window that is registering whether it will accept dropped files.

params.label: $bAccept
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether a window accepts dropped files, valid values:    True - Accept dropped files (Default).    False - Discontinue accepting dropped files.

_WinAPI_DragFinish.documentation: Releases memory that the system allocated for use in transferring file names to the application
_WinAPI_DragFinish.label: _WinAPI_DragFinish ( $hDrop )

params.label: $hDrop
params.documentation: Handle of the drop structure that describes the dropped file. This parameter is passed toWM_DROPFILES message with WPARAM parameter.

_WinAPI_DragQueryFileEx.documentation: Retrieves the names of dropped files that result from a successful drag-and-drop operation
_WinAPI_DragQueryFileEx.label: _WinAPI_DragQueryFileEx ( $hDrop [, $iFlag = 0] )

params.label: $hDrop
params.documentation: Handle of the drop structure that describes the dropped file. This parameter is passed toWM_DROPFILES message with WPARAM parameter.

params.label: $iFlag
params.documentation: [optional] The flag that specifies whether to return files folders or both, valid values:0 - Return both files and folders (Default).1 - Return files only.2 - Return folders only.

_WinAPI_DragQueryPoint.documentation: Retrieves the position of the mouse pointer at the time a file was dropped during a drag-and-drop operation
_WinAPI_DragQueryPoint.label: _WinAPI_DragQueryPoint ( $hDrop )

params.label: $hDrop
params.documentation: Handle of the drop structure that describes the dropped file. This parameter is passed to WM_DROPFILES message with WPARAM parameter.

_WinAPI_DrawAnimatedRects.documentation: Animates the caption of a window to indicate the opening of an icon or the minimizing or maximizing of a window
_WinAPI_DrawAnimatedRects.label: _WinAPI_DrawAnimatedRects ( $hWnd, $tRectFrom, $tRectTo )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window whose caption should be animated on the screen.

params.label: $tRectFrom
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure specifying the location and size of the icon or minimized window.

params.label: $tRectTo
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure specifying the location and size of the restored window.

_WinAPI_DrawBitmap.documentation: Draws a bitmap into the specified device context
_WinAPI_DrawBitmap.label: _WinAPI_DrawBitmap ( $hDC, $iX, $iY, $hBitmap [, $iRop = 0x00CC0020] )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context into which the bitmap will be drawn.

params.label: $iX
params.documentation: Specifies the logical x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the bitmap.

params.label: $iY
params.documentation: Specifies the logical y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the bitmap.

params.label: $hBitmap
params.documentation: Handle to the bitmap to be drawn.

params.label: $iRop
params.documentation: [optional] The raster-operation code (same as for _WinAPI_BitBlt()). Default is $SRCCOPY.

_WinAPI_DrawEdge.documentation: Draws one or more edges of rectangle
_WinAPI_DrawEdge.label: _WinAPI_DrawEdge ( $hDC, $tRECT, $iEdgeType, $iFlags )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context into which the edge is drawn

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: a $tagRECT structure or a pointer to it that contains the logical coordinates of the rectangle

params.label: $iEdgeType
params.documentation: Specifies the type of inner and outer edges to draw. This parameter must be a combination of one inner-border flag and one outer-border flag.The inner-border flags are as follows:    $BDR_RAISEDINNER - Raised inner edge    $BDR_SUNKENINNER - Sunken inner edgeThe outer-border flags are as follows:    $BDR_RAISEDOUTER - Raised outer edge    $BDR_SUNKENOUTER - Sunken outer edgeAlternatively, the edge parameter can specify one of the following flags:    $EDGE_BUMP - Combination of $BDR_RAISEDOUTER and $BDR_SUNKENINNER    $EDGE_ETCHED - Combination of $BDR_SUNKENOUTER and $BDR_RAISEDINNER    $EDGE_RAISED - Combination of $BDR_RAISEDOUTER and $BDR_RAISEDINNER    $EDGE_SUNKEN - Combination of $BDR_SUNKENOUTER and $BDR_SUNKENINNER

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: Specifies the type of border. This parameter can be a combination of the following values:    $BF_ADJUST - If this flag is passed, shrink the rectangle pointed to by the $pRECT parameter to exclude the edges that were drawn.If this flag is not passed, then do not change the rectangle pointed to by the $pRECT parameter    $BF_BOTTOM - Bottom of border rectangle    $BF_BOTTOMLEFT - Bottom and left side of border rectangle    $BF_BOTTOMRIGHT - Bottom and right side of border rectangle    $BF_DIAGONAL - Diagonal border    $BF_DIAGONAL_ENDBOTTOMLEFT - Diagonal border. The end point is the bottom-left corner of the rectangle; the origin is top-right corner    $BF_DIAGONAL_ENDBOTTOMRIGHT - Diagonal border. The end point is the bottom-right corner of the rectangle; the origin is top-left corner    $BF_DIAGONAL_ENDTOPLEFT - Diagonal border. The end point is the top-left corner of the rectangle; the origin is bottom-right corner    $BF_DIAGONAL_ENDTOPRIGHT - Diagonal border. The end point is the top-right corner of the rectangle; the origin is bottom-left corner    $BF_FLAT - Flat border    $BF_LEFT - Left side of border rectangle    $BF_MIDDLE - Interior of rectangle to be filled    $BF_MONO - One-dimensional border    $BF_RECT - Entire border rectangle    $BF_RIGHT - Right side of border rectangle    $BF_SOFT - Soft buttons instead of tiles    $BF_TOP - Top of border rectangle    $BF_TOPLEFT - Top and left side of border rectangle    $BF_TOPRIGHT - Top and right side of border rectangle

_WinAPI_DrawFocusRect.documentation: Draws a rectangle in the style used to indicate that the rectangle has the focus
_WinAPI_DrawFocusRect.label: _WinAPI_DrawFocusRect ( $hDC, $tRECT )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: A handle to the device context.

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure that specifies the logical coordinates of the rectangle that is to be drawn.

_WinAPI_DrawFrameControl.documentation: Draws a frame control of the specified type and style
_WinAPI_DrawFrameControl.label: _WinAPI_DrawFrameControl ( $hDC, $tRECT, $iType, $iState )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context into which the frame is drawn

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: a $tagRECT structure or a pointer to it that contains the logical coordinates of the rectangle

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: Specifies the type of frame control to draw. This parameter can be one of the following values:    $DFC_BUTTON - Standard button    $DFC_CAPTION - Title bar    $DFC_MENU - Menu bar    $DFC_POPUPMENU - Popup menu item    $DFC_SCROLL - Scroll bar

params.label: $iState
params.documentation: Specifies the initial state of the frame control. If $iType is $DFC_BUTTON, $iState can be one of the following values:    $DFCS_BUTTON3STATE - Three-state button    $DFCS_BUTTONCHECK - Check box    $DFCS_BUTTONPUSH - Push button    $DFCS_BUTTONRADIO - Radio button    $DFCS_BUTTONRADIOIMAGE - Image for radio button (nonsquare needs image)    $DFCS_BUTTONRADIOMASK - Mask for radio button (nonsquare needs mask)If $iType is $DFC_CAPTION, $iState can be one of the following values:    $DFCS_CAPTIONCLOSE - Close button    $DFCS_CAPTIONHELP - Help button    $DFCS_CAPTIONMAX - Maximize button    $DFCS_CAPTIONMIN - Minimize button    $DFCS_CAPTIONRESTORE - Restore buttonIf $iType is $DFC_MENU, $iState can be one of the following values:    $DFCS_MENUARROW - Submenu arrow    $DFCS_MENUARROWRIGHT - Submenu arrow pointing left. This is used for the right-to-left cascading menus used with right-to-left languages such as Arabic or Hebrew    $DFCS_MENUBULLET - Bullet    $DFCS_MENUCHECK - Check markIf $iType is $DFC_SCROLL, $iState can be one of the following values:    $DFCS_SCROLLCOMBOBOX - Combo box scroll bar    $DFCS_SCROLLDOWN - Down arrow of scroll bar    $DFCS_SCROLLLEFT - Left arrow of scroll bar    $DFCS_SCROLLRIGHT - Right arrow of scroll bar    $DFCS_SCROLLSIZEGRIP - Size grip in bottom-right corner of window    $DFCS_SCROLLSIZEGRIPRIGHT - Size grip in bottom-left corner of window. This is used with right-to-left languages such as Arabic or Hebrew    $DFCS_SCROLLUP - Up arrow of scroll barThe following style can be used to adjust the bounding rectangle of the push button:    $DFCS_ADJUSTRECT - Bounding rectangle is adjusted to exclude the surrounding edge of the push buttonOne or more of the following values can be used to set the state of the control to be drawn:    $DFCS_CHECKED - Button is checked    $DFCS_FLAT - Button has a flat border    $DFCS_HOT - Button is hot-tracked    $DFCS_INACTIVE - Button is inactive (grayed)    $DFCS_PUSHED - Button is pushed    $DFCS_TRANSPARENT - The background remains untouched. This flag can only be combined with $DFCS_MENUARROWUP or $DFCS_MENUARROWDOWN

_WinAPI_DrawIcon.documentation: Draws an icon or cursor into the specified device context
_WinAPI_DrawIcon.label: _WinAPI_DrawIcon ( $hDC, $iX, $iY, $hIcon )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context into which the icon or cursor is drawn

params.label: $iX
params.documentation: X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the icon

params.label: $iY
params.documentation: Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the icon

params.label: $hIcon
params.documentation: Handle to the icon to be drawn

_WinAPI_DrawIconEx.documentation: Draws an icon or cursor into the specified device context
_WinAPI_DrawIconEx.label: _WinAPI_DrawIconEx ( $hDC, $iX, $iY, $hIcon [, $iWidth = 0 [, $iHeight = 0 [, $iStep = 0 [, $hBrush = 0 [, $iFlags = 3]]]]] )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context into which the icon or cursor is drawn

params.label: $iX
params.documentation: X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the icon

params.label: $iY
params.documentation: Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the icon

params.label: $hIcon
params.documentation: Handle to the icon to be drawn

params.label: $iWidth
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the logical width of the icon or cursor.If this parameter is zero and the $iFlags parameter is "default size", the function uses the $SM_CXICON or $SM_CXCURSOR system metric value to set the width.If this is zero and "default size" is not used, the function uses the actual resource width.

params.label: $iHeight
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the logical height of the icon or cursor.If this parameter is zero and the $iFlags parameter is "default size", the function uses the $SM_CYICON or $SM_CYCURSOR system metric value to set the width.If this is zero and "default size" is not used, the function uses the actual resource height.

params.label: $iStep
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the index of the frame to draw if $hIcon identifies an animated cursor.This parameter is ignored if $hIcon does not identify an animated cursor.

params.label: $hBrush
params.documentation: [optional] Handle to a brush that the system uses for flicker-free drawing.If $hBrush is a valid brush handle, the system creates an offscreen bitmap using the specified brush for the background color, draws the icon or cursor into the bitmap, and then copies the bitmap into the device context identified by $hDC.If $hBrush is 0, the system draws the icon or cursor directly into the device context.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the drawing flags. This parameter can be one of the following values:1 - Draws the icon or cursor using the mask2 - Draws the icon or cursor using the image3 - Draws the icon or cursor using the mask and image4 - Draws the icon or cursor using the system default image rather than the user-specified image5 - Draws the icon or cursor using the width and height specified by the system metric values for cursors or icons, if the width and height parameters are set to zero.If this flag is not specified and width and height are set to zero, the function uses the actual resource size.6 - Draws the icon as an unmirrored icon

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to device context

params.label: $iX1
params.documentation: X coordinate of the line's starting point.

params.label: $iY1
params.documentation: Y coordinate of the line's starting point.

params.label: $iX2
params.documentation: X coordinate of the line's ending point.

params.label: $iY2
params.documentation: Y coordinate of the line's ending point.

_WinAPI_DrawShadowText.documentation: Draws formatted text in the specified rectangle with a drop shadow
_WinAPI_DrawShadowText.label: _WinAPI_DrawShadowText ( $hDC, $sText, $iRGBText, $iRGBShadow [, $iXOffset = 0 [, $iYOffset = 0 [, $tRECT = 0 [, $iFlags = 0]]]] )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to a device context.

params.label: $sText
params.documentation: The string that contains the text to be drawn.

params.label: $iRGBText
params.documentation: The color of the text, in RGB.

params.label: $iRGBShadow
params.documentation: The color of the shadow, in RGB.

params.label: $iXOffset
params.documentation: [optional] The x-coordinate of where the text should begin. Default is 0.

params.label: $iYOffset
params.documentation: [optional] The y-coordinate of where the text should begin. Default is 0.

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: [optional] $tagRECT structure that contains, in logical coordinates, the rectangle in which the text is to be drawn.If this parameter is 0 (Default), the size will be equal size of the device context ($hDC).

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] The flags that specifies how the text is to be drawn. This parameter can be a combination of the formatting text constants ($DT_*).

_WinAPI_DrawText.documentation: Draws formatted text in the specified rectangle
_WinAPI_DrawText.label: _WinAPI_DrawText ( $hDC, $sText, ByRef $tRECT, $iFlags )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Identifies the device context

params.label: $sText
params.documentation: The string to be drawn

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle for the text

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: Specifies the method of formatting the text:$DT_BOTTOM - Justifies the text to the bottom of the rectangle$DT_CALCRECT - Determines the width and height of the rectangle$DT_CENTER - Centers text horizontally in the rectangle$DT_EDITCONTROL - Duplicates the text-displaying characteristics of a multiline edit control$DT_END_ELLIPSIS - Replaces part of the given string with ellipses if necessary$DT_EXPANDTABS - Expands tab characters$DT_EXTERNALLEADING - Includes the font external leading in line height$DT_HIDEPREFIX - Ignores the ampersand (&) prefix character in the text.The letter that follows will not be underlined, but other mnemonic-prefix characters are still processed.$DT_INTERNAL - Uses the system font to calculate text metrics$DT_LEFT - Aligns text to the left$DT_MODIFYSTRING - Modifies the given string to match the displayed text$DT_NOCLIP - Draws without clipping$DT_NOFULLWIDTHCHARBREAK - Prevents a line break at a DBCS (double-wide character string), so that the line breaking rule is equivalent to SBCS strings.For example, this can be used in Korean windows, for more readability of icon labels.This value has no effect unless $DT_WORDBREAK is specified$DT_NOPREFIX - Turns off processing of prefix characters$DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS - For displayed text, replaces characters in the middle of the string with ellipses so that the result fits in the specified rectangle.If the string contains backslash (\) characters, $DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS preserves as much as possible of the text after the last backslash.The string is not modified unless the $DT_MODIFYSTRING flag is specified$DT_PREFIXONLY - Draws only an underline at the position of the character following the ampersand (&) prefix character.Does not draw any other characters in the string$DT_RIGHT - Aligns text to the right$DT_RTLREADING - Layout in right to left reading order for bi-directional text$DT_SINGLELINE - Displays text on a single line only$DT_TABSTOP - Sets tab stops. Bits 15-8 of $iFlags specify the number of characters for each tab$DT_TOP - Top-justifies text (single line only)$DT_VCENTER - Centers text vertically (single line only)$DT_WORDBREAK - Breaks words$DT_WORD_ELLIPSIS - Truncates any word that does not fit in the rectangle and adds ellipses

_WinAPI_DrawThemeBackground.documentation: Draws the border and fill defined by the visual style for the specified control part

params.label: $hTheme

params.label: $iPartID
params.documentation: The part to draw.

params.label: $iStateID
params.documentation: The state of the part to draw.

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context for drawing the theme-defined background image.

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle in which the background image is drawn.

params.label: $tCLIP
params.documentation: [optional] $tagRECT structure that contains a clipping rectangle.

_WinAPI_DrawThemeEdge.documentation: Draws one or more edges defined by the visual style of a rectangle
_WinAPI_DrawThemeEdge.label: _WinAPI_DrawThemeEdge ( $hTheme, $iPartID, $iStateID, $hDC, $tRECT, $iEdge, $iFlags [, $tAREA = 0] )

params.label: $hTheme
params.documentation: Handle to a window's specified theme data.

params.label: $iPartID
params.documentation: The part that contains the rectangle.

params.label: $iStateID
params.documentation: The state of the part.

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context.

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle.

params.label: $iEdge
params.documentation: The type of inner and outer edges to draw.This parameter must be a combination of one inner-border flag and one outer-border flag ($BDR_*), or one of the combination flags ($EDGE_*).

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: The type of border to draw. It can be a combination of the $BF_* constants.

params.label: $tAREA
params.documentation: [optional] $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle that receives the interior rectangle, if $BF_ADJUST is used.

_WinAPI_DrawThemeIcon.documentation: Draws an image from an image list with the icon effect defined by the visual style

params.documentation: The state of the part.

params.label: $hDC

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle in which the image is drawn.

params.label: $hIL
params.documentation: Handle to an image list that contains the image to draw.

params.label: $iIndex
params.documentation: The index of the image to draw.

_WinAPI_DrawThemeParentBackground.documentation: Draws the part of a parent control that is covered by a partially-transparent or alpha-blended child control

params.label: $iPartID
params.documentation: The part that has the desired text appearance.If this value is 0, the text is drawn in the default font, or a font selected into the device context.

params.label: $iStateID
params.documentation: The state of the part.

params.label: $hDC

params.label: $tRECT

_WinAPI_DrawThemeTextEx.documentation: Draws text using the color and font defined by the visual style
_WinAPI_DrawThemeTextEx.label: _WinAPI_DrawThemeTextEx ( $hTheme, $iPartID, $iStateID, $hDC, $sText, $tRECT, $iFlags, $tDTTOPTS )

params.label: $hTheme
params.documentation: Handle to a window's specified theme data.

params.label: $iPartID
params.documentation: The part that has the desired text appearance. If this value is 0, the text is drawn in the default font, or a font selected into the device context.

params.label: $iStateID
params.documentation: The state of the part.

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context to use for drawing.

params.label: $sText
params.documentation: The string that contains the text to draw.

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle in which the text is to be drawn.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: The string's formatting flags ($DT_*).

params.label: $tDTTOPTS
params.documentation: $tagDTTOPTS structure that defines additional formatting options.

_WinAPI_DuplicateEncryptionInfoFile.documentation: Copies the EFS metadata from one file or directory to another
_WinAPI_DuplicateEncryptionInfoFile.label: _WinAPI_DuplicateEncryptionInfoFile ( $sSrcFilePath, $sDestFilePath [, $iCreation = 2 [, $iAttributes = 0 [, $tSecurity = 0]]] )

params.label: $sSrcFilePath
params.documentation: The name of the file or directory from which the EFS metadata is to be copied.This source file or directory must be encrypted.

params.label: $sDestFilePath
params.documentation: The name of the file or directory to which the EFS metadata is to be copied.This destination file or directory does not have to be encrypted before the call to this function.If the source is a file, this parameter must also specify a file, and likewise for directories.

params.label: $iCreation
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies how the destination file or directory is to be opened.The following are the valid values of this parameter:    $CREATE_NEW    $CREATE_ALWAYS (Default)

params.label: $iAttributes
params.documentation: [optional] The file attributes of the destination file or directory.The $FILE_READ_ONLY attribute is currently not processed by this function.

params.label: $tSecurity
params.documentation: [optional] $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies the security attributes of the destination file or directory, if it does not already exist.If this parameter is 0 (Default), the file or directory gets a default security descriptor.The access-control lists (ACL) in the default security descriptor for a file or directory are inherited from its parent directory.

params.label: $hSourceProcessHandle
params.documentation: A handle to the process with the handle to be duplicated

params.label: $hSourceHandle
params.documentation: The handle to be duplicated

params.label: $hTargetProcessHandle
params.documentation: A handle to the process that is to receive the duplicated handle

params.label: $iDesiredAccess
params.documentation: The access requested for the new handle

params.label: $iInheritHandle
params.documentation: A variable that indicates whether the handle is inheritable

params.label: $iOptions
params.documentation: Optional actions

_WinAPI_DuplicateTokenEx.documentation: Creates a new primary or impersonation access token that duplicates an existing token
_WinAPI_DuplicateTokenEx.label: _WinAPI_DuplicateTokenEx ( $hToken, $iAccess, $iLevel [, $iType = 1 [, $tSecurity = 0]] )

params.label: $hToken
params.documentation: A handle to an access token opened with $TOKEN_DUPLICATE access.

params.label: $iAccess
params.documentation: The requested access rights for the new token. To request the same access rights as the existing token, specify zero.To request all access rights that are valid for the caller, specify the $TOKEN_ALL_ACCESS access.

params.label: $iLevel
params.documentation: The security impersonation levels.    $SECURITYANONYMOUS    $SECURITYIDENTIFICATION    $SECURITYIMPERSONATION    $SECURITYDELEGATION

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: [optional] The token type.    $TOKENPRIMARY    $TOKENIMPERSONATION

params.label: $tSecurity
params.documentation: [optional] $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies a security descriptor for the new token and determines whether child processes can inherit the token.If this parameter is 0 (Default), the token gets a default security descriptor and the handle cannot be inherited.If the security descriptor contains a system access control list, the token gets $ACCESS_SYSTEM_SECURITY access right, even if it was not requested.

_WinAPI_DwmDefWindowProc.documentation: Default window procedure for Desktop Window Manager (DWM) hit testing within the non-client area
_WinAPI_DwmDefWindowProc.label: _WinAPI_DwmDefWindowProc ( $hWnd, $iMsg, $wParam, $lParam )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: A handle to the window procedure that received the message.

params.label: $iMsg
params.documentation: The message.

params.label: $wParam
params.documentation: Additional message-specific information. The content of this parameter depends on the message.

params.label: $lParam
params.documentation: Additional message-specific information. The content of this parameter depends on the message.

_WinAPI_DwmEnableBlurBehindWindow.documentation: Enables the blur effect on a specified window
_WinAPI_DwmEnableBlurBehindWindow.label: _WinAPI_DwmEnableBlurBehindWindow ( $hWnd [, $bEnable = True [, $bTransition = False [, $hRgn = 0]]] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window on which the blur behind data is applied.

params.label: $bEnable
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether register or unregister the window handle to DWM blur behind, valid values:    True    - Register (Default).    False - Unregister.

params.label: $bTransition
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether colorize transition to match the maximized windows, valid values:    True    - The window's should be colorized.    False - Otherwise (Default).

params.label: $hRgn
params.documentation: [optional] The region within the client area to apply the blur behind.A value of zero (Default) will apply the blur behind the entire client area.

_WinAPI_DwmExtendFrameIntoClientArea.documentation: Extends the window frame behind the client area

params.label: $tMARGINS
params.documentation: [optional] $tagMARGINS structure that describes the margins to use when extending the frame into the client area.Negative margins are used to create the "sheet of glass" effect where the client area is rendered as a solid surface with no window border (Default).

_WinAPI_DwmSetIconicLivePreviewBitmap.label: _WinAPI_DwmSetIconicLivePreviewBitmap ( $hWnd, $hBitmap [, $bFrame = False [, $tClient = 0]] )

params.documentation: The attribute to apply to the window. This parameter can be one of the following values:    $DWMWA_NCRENDERING_POLICY    $DWMWA_TRANSITIONS_FORCEDISABLED    $DWMWA_ALLOW_NCPAINT    $DWMWA_NONCLIENT_RTL_LAYOUT    $DWMWA_FORCE_ICONIC_REPRESENTATION    $DWMWA_FLIP3D_POLICYWindows 7 or later    $DWMWA_HAS_ICONIC_BITMAP    $DWMWA_DISALLOW_PEEK    $DWMWA_EXCLUDED_FROM_PEEK

params.label: $iData

_WinAPI_DwmUpdateThumbnailProperties.documentation: Specifies Desktop Window Manager (DWM) thumbnail properties
_WinAPI_DwmUpdateThumbnailProperties.label: _WinAPI_DwmUpdateThumbnailProperties ( $hThumbnail [, $bVisible = True [, $bClientAreaOnly = False [, $iOpacity = 255 [, $tRectDest = 0 [, $tRectSrc = 0]]]]] )

params.label: $hThumbnail
params.documentation: Handle of the thumbnail to retrieve the source window size from.

params.label: $bVisible
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether make the thumbnail visible or invisible, valid values:    True  - Visible (Default).    False     - Invisible.

params.label: $bClientAreaOnly

params.label: $iOpacity
params.documentation: [optional] The opacity with which to render the thumbnail. 0 is fully transparent while 255 (Default) is fully opaque.

params.label: $tRectDest
params.documentation: [optional] $tagRECT structure containing the rectangle in the destination window the thumbnail will be rendered.By default, the size of this rectangle equal to the source size of the DWM thumbnail which returns the _WinAPI_DwmQueryThumbnailSourceSize() function.

params.label: $tRectSrc
params.documentation: [optional] $tagRECT structure containing the rectangle that specifies the region of the source window to use as the thumbnail.By default, the entire window is used as the thumbnail.
