_WinAPI_SwapWord.label: _WinAPI_SwapWord ( $iValue )

params.label: $iValue
params.documentation: The USHORT value to convert.

_WinAPI_SwitchColor.documentation: Converts a color from BGR to RGB and vice versa
_WinAPI_SwitchColor.label: _WinAPI_SwitchColor ( $iColor )

params.label: $iColor
params.documentation: The color to conversion.

_WinAPI_SwitchDesktop.documentation: Makes the specified desktop visible and activates it
_WinAPI_SwitchDesktop.label: _WinAPI_SwitchDesktop ( $hDesktop )

params.label: $hDesktop
params.documentation: Handle to the desktop. This desktop must be associated with the current window station for the process.

_WinAPI_SwitchToThisWindow.documentation: Switches the focus to a specified window and bring it to the foreground
_WinAPI_SwitchToThisWindow.label: _WinAPI_SwitchToThisWindow ( $hWnd [, $bAltTab = False] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window being switched to.

params.label: $bAltTab
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether switches to using the Alt/Ctl+Tab key sequence, valid values:    True - The window is being switched to using the Alt/Ctl+Tab key sequence.    False - Otherwise (Default).

_WinAPI_SystemParametersInfo.documentation: Retrieves or sets the value of one of the system-wide parameters
_WinAPI_SystemParametersInfo.label: _WinAPI_SystemParametersInfo ( $iAction [, $iParam = 0 [, $vParam = 0 [, $iWinIni = 0]]] )

params.label: $iAction
params.documentation: The system-wide parameter to be retrieved or set

params.label: $iParam
params.documentation: [optional] A parameter whose usage and format depends on the parameter being queried or set

params.label: $vParam
params.documentation: [optional] A parameter whose usage and format depends on the parameter being queried or set

params.label: $iWinIni
params.documentation: [optional] If a system parameter is being set, specifies whether the user profile is to be updated, andif so, whether the $WM_SETTINGCHANGE message is to be broadcast. This parameter can be zero if you don't wantto update the user profile or it can be one or more of the following values:$SPIF_UPDATEINIFILE - Writes the new setting to the user profile$SPIF_SENDCHANGE - Broadcasts the $WM_SETTINGCHANGE message after updating the user profile

_WinAPI_TabbedTextOut.documentation: Writes a character string at a specified location and expanding tabs to the specified tab-stop positions
_WinAPI_TabbedTextOut.label: _WinAPI_TabbedTextOut ( $hDC, $iX, $iY, $sText [, $aTab = 0 [, $iStart = 0 [, $iEnd = -1 [, $iOrigin = 0]]]] )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: A handle to the device context.

params.label: $iX
params.documentation: The x-coordinate of the starting point of the string, in logical units.

params.label: $iY
params.documentation: The y-coordinate of the starting point of the string, in logical units.

params.label: $sText
params.documentation: The character string to draw.

params.label: $aTab
params.documentation: [optional] The array containing the tab-stop positions, in logical units. The tab stops must be sorted in increasingorder; the smallest x-value should be the first item in the array. Also, it can be an integer value that isone tab-stop position. In this case, the tab stops are separated by the distance specified by this value.If this parameter is 0, tabs are expanded to eight times the average character width.

params.label: $iStart
params.documentation: [optional] The index of array element that contains the first tab-stop position.

params.label: $iEnd
params.documentation: [optional] The index of array element that contains the last tab-stop position.

params.label: $iOrigin
params.documentation: [optional] The x-coordinate of the starting position from which tabs are expanded, in logical units. This allowsan application to call the function several times for a single line. If the application calls the functionmore than once with the starting position set to the same value each time, the function expandsall tabs relative to the position specified by this parameter.

_WinAPI_TerminateJobObject.documentation: Terminates all processes currently associated with the job
_WinAPI_TerminateJobObject.label: _WinAPI_TerminateJobObject ( $hJob [, $iExitCode = 0] )

params.label: $hJob
params.documentation: A handle to the job whose processes will be terminated. This handle must have the $JOB_OBJECT_TERMINATEaccess right. Furthermore, the handle for each process in the job object must have the$PROCESS_TERMINATE access right.

params.label: $iExitCode
params.documentation: [optional] The exit code to be used by all processes and threads in the job object.

_WinAPI_TerminateProcess.documentation: Terminates the specified process and all of its threads
_WinAPI_TerminateProcess.label: _WinAPI_TerminateProcess ( $hProcess [, $iExitCode = 0] )

params.label: $hProcess
params.documentation: A handle to the process to be terminated. The handle must have the $PROCESS_TERMINATE access right.

params.label: $iExitCode
params.documentation: [optional] The exit code to be used by the process and threads terminated as a result of this call.

_WinAPI_TextOut.documentation: Writes a string at the specified location, using the currently selected font, background color, and text color
_WinAPI_TextOut.label: _WinAPI_TextOut ( $hDC, $iX, $iY, $sText )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context.

params.label: $iX
params.documentation: The x-coordinate, in logical coordinates, of the reference point that the system uses to align the string.

params.label: $iY
params.documentation: The y-coordinate, in logical coordinates, of the reference point that the system uses to align the string.

params.label: $sText
params.documentation: The string to be drawn.

_WinAPI_TileWindows.documentation: Tiles the specified child windows of the specified parent window
_WinAPI_TileWindows.label: _WinAPI_TileWindows ( $aWnds [, $tRECT = 0 [, $hParent = 0 [, $iFlags = 0 [, $iStart = 0 [, $iEnd = -1]]]]] )

params.label: $aWnds
params.documentation: The array of handles to the child windows to arrange. If a specified child window is a top-level windowwith the style $WS_EX_TOPMOST or $WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW, the child window is not arranged. If this parameteris 0, all child windows of the specified parent window (or of the desktop window) are arranged.

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: [optional] $tagRECT structure that specifies the rectangular area, in client coordinates, within which the windowsare arranged. If this parameter is 0 (Default), the client area of the parent window is used.

params.label: $hParent
params.documentation: [optional] Handle to the parent window. If this parameter is 0 (Default), the desktop window is assumed.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] A cascade flag. This parameter can be one or more of the following values.$MDITILE_HORIZONTAL$MDITILE_VERTICAL (Default)

params.label: $iStart
params.documentation: [optional] The index of array to start arranging at.

params.label: $iEnd
params.documentation: [optional] The index of array to stop arranging at.

_WinAPI_TrackMouseEvent.documentation: Posts messages when the mouse pointer leaves a window or hovers over a window for a specified amount of time
_WinAPI_TrackMouseEvent.label: _WinAPI_TrackMouseEvent ( $hWnd, $iFlags [, $iTime = -1] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window to track.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: The services requested. This parameter can be a combination of the following values.$TME_CANCEL$TME_HOVER$TME_LEAVE$TME_NONCLIENT$TME_QUERY

params.label: $iTime
params.documentation: [optional] The hover time-out (if $TME_HOVER was specified in $Flags), in milliseconds. Can be (-1) (Default), whichmeans to use the system default hover time-out.

_WinAPI_TransparentBlt.documentation: Performs a bit-block transfer of the color data corresponding to a rectangle of pixels
_WinAPI_TransparentBlt.label: _WinAPI_TransparentBlt ( $hDestDC, $iXDest, $iYDest, $iWidthDest, $iHeightDest, $hSrcDC, $iXSrc, $iYSrc, $iWidthSrc, $iHeightSrc, $iRGB )

params.label: $hDestDC
params.documentation: Handle to the destination device context.

params.label: $iXDest
params.documentation: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

params.label: $iYDest
params.documentation: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

params.label: $iWidthDest
params.documentation: The width, in logical units, of the destination rectangle.

params.label: $iHeightDest
params.documentation: The height, in logical units, of the destination rectangle.

params.label: $hSrcDC
params.documentation: Handle to the source device context.

params.label: $iXSrc
params.documentation: The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

params.label: $iYSrc
params.documentation: The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.

params.label: $iWidthSrc
params.documentation: The width, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

params.label: $iHeightSrc
params.documentation: The height, in logical units, of the source rectangle.

params.label: $iRGB
params.documentation: The RGB color in the source bitmap to treat as transparent.

_WinAPI_TwipsPerPixelX.documentation: Returns the width of a pixel, in twips
_WinAPI_TwipsPerPixelX.label: _WinAPI_TwipsPerPixelX (  )

_WinAPI_TwipsPerPixelY.documentation: Returns the height of a pixel, in twips
_WinAPI_TwipsPerPixelY.label: _WinAPI_TwipsPerPixelY (  )

_WinAPI_UnhookWindowsHookEx.documentation: Removes a hook procedure installed in a hook chain by the _WinAPI_SetWindowsHookEx function
_WinAPI_UnhookWindowsHookEx.label: _WinAPI_UnhookWindowsHookEx ( $hHook )

params.label: $hHook
params.documentation: Handle to the hook to be removed

params.label: $hEventHook
params.documentation: Handle to the event hook returned in the previous call to _WinAPI_SetWinEventHook().

_WinAPI_UnionRect.documentation: Creates the union of two rectangles
_WinAPI_UnionRect.label: _WinAPI_UnionRect ( $tRECT1, $tRECT2 )

params.label: $tRECT1
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure that contains the first source rectangle.

params.label: $tRECT2
params.documentation: $tagRECT structure that contains the second source rectangle.

_WinAPI_UnionStruct.documentation: Creates the structure of two structures
_WinAPI_UnionStruct.label: _WinAPI_UnionStruct ( $tStruct1, $tStruct2 [, $sStruct = ''] )

params.label: $tStruct1
params.documentation: The structure that contains the first source data.

params.label: $tStruct2
params.documentation: The structure that contains the second source data.

params.label: $sStruct
params.documentation: [optional] The string representing the final structure (same as for the DllStructCreate() function).

_WinAPI_UniqueHardwareID.documentation: Generates a unique hardware identifier (ID) for local computer
_WinAPI_UniqueHardwareID.label: _WinAPI_UniqueHardwareID ( [$iFlags = 0] )

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] The flags that specifies what information would be used to generate ID. This parameter can be one or more of the following values.$UHID_MB - Uses information about your motherboard. This flag is used by default regardless of whether specified or not.$UHID_BIOS - Uses information from BIOS.$UHID_CPU - Uses information about your processor(s). Note that $UHID_CPU flag reduces the function speed.$UHID_HDD - Uses information about the installed hard drives. Any change in the configuration disks will change ID returned by this function. Taken into account only non-removable disks with an ATA or SATA interfaces.$UHID_All - The sum of all the previous flags.

params.label: $hLocale
params.documentation: The input locale identifier to be unloaded.

_WinAPI_UnlockFile.documentation: Unlocks a region in an open file
_WinAPI_UnlockFile.label: _WinAPI_UnlockFile ( $hFile, $iOffset, $iLength )

params.label: $hFile
params.documentation: Handle to the file that contains a region locked with _WinAPI_LockFile() function.

params.label: $iOffset
params.documentation: The starting byte offset in the file where the locked region begins.

params.label: $iLength
params.documentation: The length of the byte range to be unlocked.

_WinAPI_UnmapViewOfFile.documentation: Unmaps a mapped view of a file from the calling process's address space
_WinAPI_UnmapViewOfFile.label: _WinAPI_UnmapViewOfFile ( $pAddress )

params.label: $pAddress
params.documentation: A pointer to the base address of the mapped view of a file that is to be unmapped.This value must be identical to the value returned by a previous call to the _WinAPI_MapViewOfFile() function.

_WinAPI_UnregisterApplicationRestart.documentation: Removes the active instance of an application from the restart list
_WinAPI_UnregisterApplicationRestart.label: _WinAPI_UnregisterApplicationRestart (  )

_WinAPI_UnregisterClass.documentation: Unregisters a window class, freeing the memory required for the class
_WinAPI_UnregisterClass.label: _WinAPI_UnregisterClass ( $sClass [, $hInstance = 0] )

params.label: $sClass
params.documentation: A null-terminated string or a class atom. If $sClass is a string, it specifies the window classname. This class name must have been registered by a previous call to the _WinAPI_RegisterClass()or _WinAPI_RegisterClassEx() function. If this parameter is an atom, it must be in the low-orderword of $sClass; the high-order word must be zero.

params.label: $hInstance
params.documentation: [optional] Handle to the instance of the module that created the class.

_WinAPI_UnregisterHotKey.documentation: Frees a hot key previously registered by the calling thread
_WinAPI_UnregisterHotKey.label: _WinAPI_UnregisterHotKey ( $hWnd, $iID )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window associated with the hot key to be freed. This parameter should be 0 if thehot key is not associated with a window.

params.label: $iID
params.documentation: Specifies the identifier of the hot key to be freed.

params.label: $hNotify
params.documentation: Handle returned from the _WinAPI_RegisterPowerSettingNotification() function.

_WinAPI_UpdateLayeredWindow.documentation: Updates the position, size, shape, content, and translucency of a layered window
_WinAPI_UpdateLayeredWindow.label: _WinAPI_UpdateLayeredWindow ( $hWnd, $hDestDC, $tPTDest, $tSize, $hSrcDC, $tPTSrce, $iRGB, $tBlend, $iFlags )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to a layered window. A layered window is created by specifying $WS_EX_LAYERED when creating the window.

params.label: $hDestDC
params.documentation: Handle to a device context for the screen

params.label: $tPTDest
params.documentation: A $tagPOINT structure or a pointer to it that specifies the new screen position of the layered window.If the current position is not changing, this can be zero.

params.label: $tSize
params.documentation: A $tagSIZE structure or a pointer to it that specifies the new size of the layered window.If the size of the window is not changing, this can be 0.

params.label: $hSrcDC
params.documentation: Handle to a device context for the surface that defines the layered window.This handle can be obtained by calling the _WinAPI_CreateCompatibleDC() function.

params.label: $tPTSrce
params.documentation: A $tagPOINT structure or a pointer to it that specifies the location of the layer in the device context

params.label: $iRGB
params.documentation: The color key to be used when composing the layered window

params.label: $tBlend
params.documentation: A $tagBLENDFUNCTION structure or a pointer to it that specifies the transparency value to be used when composing the layered window.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: This parameter can be one of the following values.    $ULW_ALPHA - Use $tblend as the blend function    $ULW_COLORKEY - Use $iRGB as the transparency color    $ULW_OPAQUE - Draw an opaque layered window

_WinAPI_UpdateLayeredWindowEx.documentation: Updates a bitmap translucency of a layered window
_WinAPI_UpdateLayeredWindowEx.label: _WinAPI_UpdateLayeredWindowEx ( $hWnd, $iX, $iY, $hBitmap [, $iOpacity = 255 [, $bDelete = False]] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to a layered window. A layered window is created by specifying $WS_EX_LAYERED when its creating.

params.label: $iX
params.documentation: The new position of the left side of the window.

params.label: $iY
params.documentation: The new position of the top of the window.

params.label: $hBitmap
params.documentation: Handle to the bitmap that will be set to the layered window.

params.label: $iOpacity
params.documentation: [optional] The alpha transparency value to be used on the entire source bitmap. Default is 255.

params.label: $bDelete
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether to delete the bitmap after updated the window, valid values:    True - Bitmap will be deleted if the function succeeds.    False - Do not delete, you must release the bitmap when you are finished using it (Default).

_WinAPI_UpdateLayeredWindowIndirect.documentation: Updates the position, size, shape, content, and translucency of a layered window
_WinAPI_UpdateLayeredWindowIndirect.label: _WinAPI_UpdateLayeredWindowIndirect ( $hWnd, $tULWINFO )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to a layered window. A layered window is created by specifying $WS_EX_LAYERED when its creating.

params.label: $tULWINFO
params.documentation: $tagUPDATELAYEREDWINDOWINFO structure that contains the information for the window.

_WinAPI_UpdateResource.documentation: Adds, deletes, or replaces a resource in a portable executable (PE) file
_WinAPI_UpdateResource.label: _WinAPI_UpdateResource ( $hUpdate, $sType, $sName, $iLanguage, $pData, $iSize )

params.label: $hUpdate
params.documentation: A module handle returned by the _WinAPI_BeginUpdateResource(), referencing the file to be updated.

params.label: $sType
params.documentation: The resource type to be updated. Alternatively, rather than a pointer, this parameter can be aninteger value representing a predefined resource type. If the first character of the string is apound sign (#), then the remaining characters represent a decimal number that specifies the integeridentifier of the resource type. For example, the string "#258" represents the identifier 258.Also, you can use a predefined resource types ($RT_*).

params.label: $sName
params.documentation: The name of the resource to be updated. This parameter can be string or integer value.

params.label: $iLanguage
params.documentation: The language identifier of the resource.

params.label: $pData
params.documentation: The resource data to be inserted into the file indicated by $hUpdate parameter. If the resource isone of the predefined types, the data must be valid and properly aligned. Note that this is the rawbinary data, not the data provided by _WinAPI_LoadIcon(), _WinAPI_LoadString(), or other resource-specific load functions. All data containing strings or text must be in Unicode format. If $pDatais 0 and $iSize is 0, the specified resource is deleted from the file indicated by $hUpdate.

params.label: $iSize
params.documentation: The size, in bytes, of the resource data at $pData.

_WinAPI_UpdateWindow.documentation: Updates the client area of a window by sending a WM_PAINT message to the window
_WinAPI_UpdateWindow.label: _WinAPI_UpdateWindow ( $hWnd )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle of window to update

_WinAPI_UrlApplyScheme.documentation: Determines a scheme for a specified URL string, and returns a string with an appropriate prefix
_WinAPI_UrlApplyScheme.label: _WinAPI_UrlApplyScheme ( $sUrl [, $iFlags = 1] )

params.label: $sUrl
params.documentation: The URL.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] The flags that specify how to determine the scheme. It can be a combination of the following values.$URL_APPLY_DEFAULT (Default)$URL_APPLY_GUESSSCHEME$URL_APPLY_GUESSFILE$URL_APPLY_FORCEAPPLY

_WinAPI_UrlCanonicalize.documentation: Converts a URL string into canonical form
_WinAPI_UrlCanonicalize.label: _WinAPI_UrlCanonicalize ( $sUrl, $iFlags )

params.label: $sUrl
params.documentation: The URL.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: The flags that specify how the URL is to be converted. It can be a combination of the following values.    $URL_DONT_SIMPLIFY    $URL_ESCAPE_PERCENT    $URL_ESCAPE_SPACES_ONLY    $URL_ESCAPE_UNSAFE    $URL_NO_META    $URL_PLUGGABLE_PROTOCOL    $URL_UNESCAPEWindows 7 or later    $URL_ESCAPE_AS_UTF8

_WinAPI_UrlCombine.documentation: Combines the base an relative URLs in canonical form
_WinAPI_UrlCombine.label: _WinAPI_UrlCombine ( $sUrl, $sPart [, $iFlags = 0] )

params.label: $sUrl
params.documentation: The base URL.

params.label: $sPart
params.documentation: The relative URL.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] The flags that specify how the URL is to be converted. It can be a combination of the following values.    $URL_DONT_SIMPLIFY    $URL_ESCAPE_PERCENT    $URL_ESCAPE_SPACES_ONLY    $URL_ESCAPE_UNSAFE    $URL_NO_META    $URL_PLUGGABLE_PROTOCOL    $URL_UNESCAPEWindows 7 or later    $URL_ESCAPE_AS_UTF8

_WinAPI_UrlCompare.documentation: Makes a case-sensitive comparison of two URL strings
_WinAPI_UrlCompare.label: _WinAPI_UrlCompare ( $sUrl1, $sUrl2 [, $bIgnoreSlash = False] )

params.label: $sUrl1
params.documentation: The first URL.

params.label: $sUrl2
params.documentation: The second URL.

params.label: $bIgnoreSlash
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether to ignore a trailing '/' character on either or both URLs, valid values:    True - The function ignores a trailing characters.    False - The function takes into account the trailing characters (Default).

_WinAPI_UrlCreateFromPath.documentation: Converts a Microsoft MS-DOS path to a canonicalized URL
_WinAPI_UrlCreateFromPath.label: _WinAPI_UrlCreateFromPath ( $sFilePath )

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: The MS-DOS path.

_WinAPI_UrlFixup.documentation: Attempts to correct a URL whose protocol identifier is incorrect
_WinAPI_UrlFixup.label: _WinAPI_UrlFixup ( $sUrl )

params.label: $sUrl
params.documentation: The URL to be corrected.

_WinAPI_UrlGetPart.documentation: Retrieves a specified part from the URL
_WinAPI_UrlGetPart.label: _WinAPI_UrlGetPart ( $sUrl, $iPart )

params.label: $sUrl
params.documentation: The URL.

params.label: $iPart
params.documentation: The part of the URL to retrieve. It can be one of the following values.$URL_PART_HOSTNAME$URL_PART_PASSWORD$URL_PART_PORT$URL_PART_QUERY$URL_PART_SCHEME$URL_PART_USERNAME

params.label: $sUrl
params.documentation: The URL.

params.label: $iLength
params.documentation: [optional] The length of the hash data, in bytes. It should be no larger than 256, otherwise, the function fails. Default is 32.

_WinAPI_UrlIs.documentation: Tests whether or not a URL is a specified type
_WinAPI_UrlIs.label: _WinAPI_UrlIs ( $sUrl [, $iType = 0] )

params.label: $sUrl
params.documentation: The URL.

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: [optional] The type of URL to be tested for. It can be one of the following values.$URLIS_APPLIABLE$URLIS_DIRECTORY$URLIS_FILEURL$URLIS_HASQUERY$URLIS_NOHISTORY$URLIS_OPAQUE$URLIS_URL (Default)

_WinAPI_UserHandleGrantAccess.documentation: Grants or denies access to a handle to a User object to a job that has a user-interface restriction
_WinAPI_UserHandleGrantAccess.label: _WinAPI_UserHandleGrantAccess ( $hObject, $hJob, $bGrant )

params.label: $hObject
params.documentation: Handle to the User object.

params.label: $hJob
params.documentation: Handle to the job to be granted access to the User handle.

params.label: $bGrant
params.documentation: Specifies whether to grant or deny access to the User handle, valid values:True - The processes associated with the job can recognize and use the handle.False - The processes cannot use the handle.

_WinAPI_ValidateRect.documentation: Removes a rectangle from the current update region of the specified window
_WinAPI_ValidateRect.label: _WinAPI_ValidateRect ( $hWnd [, $tRECT = 0] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window whose update region is to be modified. If this parameter is 0, the systeminvalidates and redraws all windows and sends the WM_ERASEBKGND and WM_NCPAINT messages to the windowprocedure before the function returns.

params.label: $tRECT
params.documentation: [optional] $tagRECT structure that contains the client coordinates of the rectangle to be removed from theupdate region. If this parameter is 0 (Default), the entire client area is removed.

_WinAPI_ValidateRgn.documentation: Removes a region from the current update region of the specified window
_WinAPI_ValidateRgn.label: _WinAPI_ValidateRgn ( $hWnd [, $hRgn = 0] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the window whose update region is to be modified.

params.label: $hRgn
params.documentation: [optional] Handle to a region that defines the area to be removed from the update region. If this parameter is 0 (Default),the entire client area is removed.

_WinAPI_VerQueryRoot.documentation: Retrieves the fixed version information from the specified version-information resource
_WinAPI_VerQueryRoot.label: _WinAPI_VerQueryRoot ( $pData )

params.label: $pData
params.documentation: A pointer to the buffer that contains the version-information resource returned by the_WinAPI_GetFileVersionInfo() function.

_WinAPI_VerQueryValue.documentation: Retrieves the non-fixed (strings) version information from the specified version-information resource
_WinAPI_VerQueryValue.label: _WinAPI_VerQueryValue ( $pData [, $sValues = ''] )

params.label: $pData
params.documentation: A pointer to the buffer that contains the version-information resource returned by the_WinAPI_GetFileVersionInfo() function.

params.label: $sValues
params.documentation: [optional] The string containing the field names for which you want to get values. The names must be separated by a "|".For example, "name1|name2|...|namei". If some fields do not exist, the corresponding array elements is an empty string.If this parameter is not specified (empty string), uses the reserved names (12) in the following sequence:    $FV_COMMENTS ("Comments")    $FV_COMPANYNAME ("CompanyName")    $FV_FILEDESCRIPTION ("FileDescription")    $FV_FILEVERSION ("FileVersion")    $FV_INTERNALNAME ("InternalName")    $FV_LEGALCOPYRIGHT ("LegalCopyright")    $FV_LEGALTRADEMARKS ("LegalTrademarks")    $FV_ORIGINALFILENAME ("OriginalFilename")    $FV_PRODUCTNAME ("ProductName")    $FV_PRODUCTVERSION ("ProductVersion")    $FV_PRIVATEBUILD ("PrivateBuild")    $FV_SPECIALBUILD ("SpecialBuild")Constants are defined in FileConstants.au3.

_WinAPI_VerQueryValueEx.documentation: Retrieves the text information from the version-information resource of the specified binary module
_WinAPI_VerQueryValueEx.label: _WinAPI_VerQueryValueEx ( $hModule [, $sValues = '' [, $iLanguage = 0x0400]] )

params.label: $hModule
params.documentation: The handle to a module to retrieve information. Also, this parameter can specify the name of themodule to load, it must be a full or relative path. If this parameter is 0 or an empty string, that isequivalent to passing in a handle to the module used to create the current process.

params.label: $sValues
params.documentation: [optional] The string containing the field names for which you want to get values. The names must be separated by a "|".For example, "name1|name2|...|namei". If some fields do not exist, the corresponding array elements is an empty string.If this parameter is not specified (empty string), uses the reserved names (12) in the following sequence:    $FV_COMMENTS ("Comments")    $FV_COMPANYNAME ("CompanyName")    $FV_FILEDESCRIPTION ("FileDescription")    $FV_FILEVERSION ("FileVersion")    $FV_INTERNALNAME ("InternalName")    $FV_LEGALCOPYRIGHT ("LegalCopyright")    $FV_LEGALTRADEMARKS ("LegalTrademarks")    $FV_ORIGINALFILENAME ("OriginalFilename")    $FV_PRODUCTNAME ("ProductName")    $FV_PRODUCTVERSION ("ProductVersion")    $FV_PRIVATEBUILD ("PrivateBuild")    $FV_SPECIALBUILD ("SpecialBuild")Constants are defined in FileConstants.au3.

params.label: $iLanguage
params.documentation: [optional] The language identifier of the version-information resource of interest. To retrieve information foruser default language set this parameter to $LOCALE_USER_DEFAULT (Default). To retrieve information for alllanguages that are located in the resource set this parameter to (-1).

_WinAPI_WaitForInputIdle.documentation: Waits until a process is waiting for user input with no input pending, or a time out
_WinAPI_WaitForInputIdle.label: _WinAPI_WaitForInputIdle ( $hProcess [, $iTimeout = -1] )

params.label: $hProcess
params.documentation: A handle to the process. If this process is a console application or does not have a messagequeue, this function returns immediately.

params.label: $iTimeOut
params.documentation: [optional] The time out interval, in milliseconds. If set to -1, the function does not return until theprocess is idle.

_WinAPI_WaitForMultipleObjects.documentation: Waits until one or all of the specified objects are in the signaled state
_WinAPI_WaitForMultipleObjects.label: _WinAPI_WaitForMultipleObjects ( $iCount, $paHandles [, $bWaitAll = False [, $iTimeout = -1]] )

params.label: $iCount
params.documentation: The number of object handles in the array pointed to by $paHandles

params.label: $paHandles
params.documentation: Pointer to an array of object handles

params.label: $bWaitAll
params.documentation: [optional] If True, the function returns when the state of all objects in the $paHandles array is signaled.If False, the function returns when the state of any one of the objects is set to signaled.In the latter case, the return value indicates the object whose state caused the function to return.

params.label: $iTimeout
params.documentation: [optional] The time-out interval, in milliseconds.The function returns if the interval elapses, even if the conditions specified by the $bWaitAll parameter are not met.If 0, the function tests the states of the specified objects and returns immediately.If -1, the function's time-out interval never elapses.

_WinAPI_WaitForSingleObject.documentation: Waits until the specified object is in the signaled state
_WinAPI_WaitForSingleObject.label: _WinAPI_WaitForSingleObject ( $hHandle [, $iTimeout = -1] )

params.label: $hHandle
params.documentation: A handle to the object

params.label: $iTimeout
params.documentation: [optional] The time-out interval, in milliseconds. The function returns if the interval elapses, even ifthe conditions specified by the fWaitAll parameter are not met. If 0, the function tests the states of thespecified objects and returns immediately. If -1, the function's time-out interval never elapses.

_WinAPI_WideCharToMultiByte.documentation: Converts a Unicode string to a multibyte string
_WinAPI_WideCharToMultiByte.label: _WinAPI_WideCharToMultiByte ( $vUnicode [, $iCodePage = 0 [, $bRetString = True]] )

params.label: $vUnicode
params.documentation: String, DllStruct or Pointer to a byte array structure containing Unicode text to be converted

params.label: $iCodePage
params.documentation: [optional] Code page to use in performing the conversion:    0 - The current system Windows ANSI code page    1 - The current system OEM code page    2 - The current system Macintosh code page    3 - The Windows ANSI code page for the current thread    42 - Symbol code page    65000 - UTF-7    65001 - UTF-8

params.label: $bRetString
params.documentation: [optional] Flags that indicate whether to return a String or a DllStruct (default True : String)

_WinAPI_WidenPath.documentation: Redefines the current path as the area that would be painted if the path were stroked
_WinAPI_WidenPath.label: _WinAPI_WidenPath ( $hDC )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to a device context that contains a closed path.

_WinAPI_WindowFromDC.documentation: Retrieves a handle to the window associated with the specified display device context (DC)
_WinAPI_WindowFromDC.label: _WinAPI_WindowFromDC ( $hDC )

params.label: $hDC
params.documentation: Handle to the device context from which a handle to the associated window is to be retrieved.

_WinAPI_WindowFromPoint.documentation: Retrieves the handle of the window that contains the specified point
_WinAPI_WindowFromPoint.label: _WinAPI_WindowFromPoint ( ByRef $tPoint )

params.label: $tPoint
params.documentation: $tagPOINT structure that defines the point to be checked

_WinAPI_WordToShort.documentation: Converts a value of type WORD to a value of type SHORT
_WinAPI_WordToShort.label: _WinAPI_WordToShort ( $iValue )

params.label: $iValue
params.documentation: The value to be converted.

_WinAPI_Wow64EnableWow64FsRedirection.documentation: Enables or disables file system redirection for the calling thread
_WinAPI_Wow64EnableWow64FsRedirection.label: _WinAPI_Wow64EnableWow64FsRedirection ( $bEnable )

params.label: $bEnable
params.documentation: Specifies whether enable or disable the WOW64 system folder redirection, valid values:    True - Enable.    False - Disable.

_WinAPI_WriteConsole.documentation: Writes a character string to a console screen buffer
_WinAPI_WriteConsole.label: _WinAPI_WriteConsole ( $hConsole, $sText )

params.label: $hConsole
params.documentation: Handle to the console screen buffer

params.label: $sText
params.documentation: Text to be written to the console screen buffer

_WinAPI_WriteFile.documentation: Writes data to a file at the position specified by the file pointer
_WinAPI_WriteFile.label: _WinAPI_WriteFile ( $hFile, $pBuffer, $iToWrite, ByRef $iWritten [, $tOverlapped = 0] )

params.label: $hFile
params.documentation: Handle to the file to be written

params.label: $pBuffer
params.documentation: Pointer to the buffer containing the data to be written

params.label: $iToWrite
params.documentation: Number of bytes to be written to the file

params.label: $iWritten
params.documentation: The number of bytes written

params.label: $tOverlapped
params.documentation: [optional] A $tagOVERLAPPED structure or a pointer to it

_WinAPI_WriteProcessMemory.documentation: Writes memory in a specified process
_WinAPI_WriteProcessMemory.label: _WinAPI_WriteProcessMemory ( $hProcess, $pBaseAddress, $pBuffer, $iSize, ByRef $iWritten [, $sBuffer = "ptr"] )

params.label: $hProcess
params.documentation: Identifies an open handle to a process whose memory is to be written to

params.label: $pBaseAddress
params.documentation: Points to the base address in the specified process to be written to

params.label: $pBuffer
params.documentation: Points to the buffer that supplies data to be written into the address space

params.label: $iSize
params.documentation: Specifies the number of bytes to write into the specified process

params.label: $iWritten
params.documentation: The actual number of bytes transferred into the specified process

params.label: $sBuffer
params.documentation: [optional] Contains the data type that $pBuffer represents

_WinAPI_ZeroMemory.documentation: Fills a block of memory with zeros
_WinAPI_ZeroMemory.label: _WinAPI_ZeroMemory ( $pMemory, $iLength )

params.label: $pMemory
params.documentation: A pointer to the starting address of a memory to be filled.

params.label: $iLength
params.documentation: The number of bytes to be filled.

_WinNet_AddConnection.documentation: Connects a local device to a network resource
_WinNet_AddConnection.label: _WinNet_AddConnection ( $sLocalName, $sRemoteName [, $sPassword = 0] )

params.label: $sLocalName
params.documentation: Name of a local device to be redirected, such as "F:" or "LPT1".The string is treated in a case-insensitive manner.If the Null keyword or an empty, a connection to the network resource is made without redirecting the local device.

params.label: $sRemoteName
params.documentation: Name of the network resource to connect to

params.label: $sPassword
params.documentation: [optional] Password to be used to make a connection.This parameter is usually the password associated with the current user.If 0, the default password is used.If the string is empty, no password is used.

_WinNet_AddConnection2.documentation: Connects a local device to a network resource
_WinNet_AddConnection2.label: _WinNet_AddConnection2 ( $sLocalName, $sRemoteName [, $sUserName = 0 [, $sPassword = 0 [, $iType = 1 [, $iOptions = 1]]]] )

params.label: $sLocalName
params.documentation: Name of a local device to be redirected, such as "F:" or "LPT1". The string is treated in acase-insensitive manner. If the Null keyword or an empty, a connection to the network resource is made without redirecting the localdevice.

params.label: $sRemoteName
params.documentation: Name of the network resource to connect to

params.label: $sUsername
params.documentation: [optional] User name for making the connection. If 0, the function uses the default user name.

params.label: $sPassword
params.documentation: [optional] Password to be used to make a connection. If 0, the default password is used. If the string isempty, no password is used.

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the type of network resource to connect to:    0 - Any (only if $sLocalName is 0)    1 - Disk    2 - Print

params.label: $iOptions
params.documentation: [optional] Connection options. Can be one or more of the following:    1 - The network resource connection should be remembered    2 - The operating system may interact with the user for authentication purposes    4 - The system not to use any default setting for user names or passwords without offering the user the        opportunity to supply an alternative. This flag is ignored unless bit 2 (interactive) is also set.    8 - Forces the redirection of a local device when making the connection    16 - The operating system prompts the user for authentication using the command line instead of a GUI.        This flag is ignored unless bit 2 (interactive) is also set.    32 - If this bit is set, and the operating system prompts for a credential, the credential is saved by the credential manager.        If the credential manager is disabled for the caller's logon session, or if the network        provider does not support saving credentials, this flag is ignored.        This flag is also ignored unless you setbit 5 (command line instead of GUI).

_WinNet_AddConnection3.documentation: Connects a local device to a network resource
_WinNet_AddConnection3.label: _WinNet_AddConnection3 ( $hWnd, $sLocalName, $sRemoteName [, $sUserName = 0 [, $sPassword = 0 [, $iType = 1 [, $iOptions = 1]]]] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to a window that the provider of network resources can use as an owner window fordialogs. Use this parameter if you set bit 2 (interactive) in the Options parameter. This parameter can be 0.

params.label: $sLocalName
params.documentation: Name of a local device to be redirected, such as "F:" or "LPT1". The string is treated in acase-insensitive manner. If the Null keyword or an empty, a connection to the network resource is made without redirecting the localdevice.

params.label: $sRemoteName
params.documentation: Name of the network resource to connect to

params.label: $sUsername
params.documentation: [optional] User name for making the connection. If 0, the function uses the default user name.

params.label: $sPassword
params.documentation: [optional] Password to be used to make a connection. If 0, the default password is used. If the string isempty, no password is used.

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the type of network resource to connect to:    0 - Any (only if $sLocalName is 0)    1 - Disk    2 - Print

params.label: $iOptions
params.documentation: [optional] Connection options. Can be one or more of the following:    1 - The network resource connection should be remembered    2 - The operating system may interact with the user for authentication purposes    4 - The system not to use any default setting for user names or passwords without offering the user the opportunity to supply an alternative. This flag is ignored unless bit 2 (interactive) is also set.    8 - Forces the redirection of a local device when making the connection    16 - The operating system prompts the user for authentication using the command line instead of a GUI.        This flag is ignored unless bit 2 (interactive) is also set.    32 - If this bit is set, and the operating system prompts for a credential, the credential is saved by the credential manager.        If the credential manager is disabled for the caller's logon session, or if the network        provider does not support saving credentials, this flag is ignored.        This flag is also ignored unless you setbit 5 (command line instead of GUI).

params.label: $sName
params.documentation: Name of either the redirected local device or the remote network resource to disconnect from.When this parameter specifies a redirected local device, the function cancels only the specified device redirection.If the parameter specifies a remote network resource, only the connections to remote networks without devices are cancelled.

params.label: $bForce
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether or not the disconnection should occur if there are open files or jobs on the connection.If this parameter is False, the function fails if there are open files or jobs.

params.label: $sName
params.documentation: Name of either the redirected local device or the remote network resource to disconnect from.When this parameter specifies a redirected local device, the function cancels only the specified device redirection.If the parameter specifies a remote network resource, only the connections to remote networks without devices are cancelled.

params.label: $bUpdate
params.documentation: [optional] If True, the users profile is updated with the information that the connection is no longer a persistent one.

params.label: $bForce
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether or not the disconnection should occur if there are open files or jobs on the connection.If this parameter is False, the function fails if there are open files or jobs.

_WinNet_CloseEnum.documentation: Ends a network resource enumeration started by a call to _WinNet_OpenEnum()
_WinNet_CloseEnum.label: _WinNet_CloseEnum ( $hEnum )

params.label: $hEnum
params.documentation: Handle that identifies an enumeration instance. The handle is returned by the _WinNet_OpenEnum() function

_WinNet_ConnectionDialog.documentation: Starts a general browsing dialog box for connecting to network resources
_WinNet_ConnectionDialog.label: _WinNet_ConnectionDialog ( $hWnd )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the owner window for the dialog box

_WinNet_ConnectionDialog1.documentation: Starts a general browsing dialog box for connecting to network resources
_WinNet_ConnectionDialog1.label: _WinNet_ConnectionDialog1 ( $hWnd [, $sRemoteName = "" [, $iFlags = 2]] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the owner window for the dialog box

params.label: $sRemoteName
params.documentation: [optional] Name of the network resource to connect to

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] Dialog box options. Can be one or more of the following:    1 - Display a read-only path instead of allowing the user to type in a path    2 - Enter the most recently used paths into the combination box    4 - Do not show the restore the connection at logon checkbox    8 - Restore the connection at logon    16 - Do not restore the connection at logon

_WinNet_DisconnectDialog.documentation: Starts a general browsing dialog box for disconnecting from network resources
_WinNet_DisconnectDialog.label: _WinNet_DisconnectDialog ( $hWnd )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the owner window for the dialog box

_WinNet_DisconnectDialog1.documentation: Starts a general browsing dialog box for disconnecting from network resources
_WinNet_DisconnectDialog1.label: _WinNet_DisconnectDialog1 ( $hWnd, $sLocalName [, $sRemoteName = "" [, $iFlags = 1]] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to the owner window for the dialog box

params.label: $sLocalName
params.documentation: Name of a local device, such as "F:" or "LPT1"

params.label: $sRemoteName
params.documentation: [optional] Name of the network resource to disconnect. This member can be 0 if $LocalName is specified.When $sLocalName is specified, the connection to the network resource redirected from $sLocalName is disconnected.

params.label: $iFlags
params.documentation: [optional] Flags describing the connection. Can be a combination of:1 - If this value is set, the specified connection is no longer a persistent one.    This flag is valid only if $sLocalName specifies a local device.2 - If this value is NOT set, the system applies force when disconnecting

_WinNet_EnumResource.documentation: Continues an enumeration of network resources
_WinNet_EnumResource.label: _WinNet_EnumResource ( $hEnum, ByRef $iCount, $pBuffer, ByRef $iBufSize )

params.label: $hEnum
params.documentation: Handle that identifies an enumeration instance. The handle is returned by the _WinNet_OpenEnum() function.

params.label: $iCount
params.documentation: Number of entries requested. If the number requested is –1, the function returns as many entries as possible.If the function succeeds, on return the variable contains the number of entries actually read.

params.label: $pBuffer
params.documentation: Pointer to the buffer that receives the enumeration results.The results are returned as an array of $tagNETRESOURCE structures.The buffer must be large enough to hold the structures plus the strings to which their members point.The buffer is valid until the next call using the handle specified by $hEnum.The order of $tagNETRESOURCE structures in the array is not predictable.

params.label: $iBufSize
params.documentation: The size of the buffer, in bytes.If the buffer is too small to receive even one entry, this parameter receives the required size of the buffer.

_WinNet_GetConnection.documentation: Retrieves the name of the network resource associated with a local device
_WinNet_GetConnection.label: _WinNet_GetConnection ( $sLocalName )

params.label: $sLocalName
params.documentation: The name of the local device to get the network name for

_WinNet_GetConnectionPerformance.documentation: Returns information about the performance of a network connection resource
_WinNet_GetConnectionPerformance.label: _WinNet_GetConnectionPerformance ( $sLocalName, $sRemoteName )

params.label: $sLocalName
params.documentation: Name of a local device, such as "F:" or "LPT1", that is redirected to a network resource to be queried.If blank, the network resource is specified in $sRemoteName.If this parameter specifies a local device $sRemoteName is ignored.

params.label: $sRemoteName
params.documentation: Name of the network resource to query.The resource must currently have an established connection.For example, if the resource is a file on a file server, then having the file open will ensure the connection.

_WinNet_GetLastError.documentation: Retrieves the most recent extended error
_WinNet_GetLastError.label: _WinNet_GetLastError ( ByRef $iError, ByRef $sError, ByRef $sName )

params.label: $iError
params.documentation: On return, contains the most recent extended error code

params.label: $sError
params.documentation: On return, contains the most recent extended error code message

params.label: $sName

_WinNet_GetNetworkInformation.documentation: Returns extended information about a specific network provider
_WinNet_GetNetworkInformation.label: _WinNet_GetNetworkInformation ( $sName )

params.label: $sName
params.documentation: The network provider for which information is required

_WinNet_GetProviderName.label: _WinNet_GetProviderName ( $iType )

params.label: $iType

_WinNet_GetResourceInformation.label: _WinNet_GetResourceInformation ( $sRemoteName [, $sProvider = "" [, $iType = 0]] )

params.label: $sProvider
params.documentation: [optional] The name of the provider that owns the resource.This member can be blank if the provider name is unknown.

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: [optional] Type of resource.This member can be 0 if it is not known.

_WinNet_GetResourceParent.documentation: Returns the parent of a network resource in the network browse hierarchy
_WinNet_GetResourceParent.label: _WinNet_GetResourceParent ( $sRemoteName, $sProvider [, $iType = 0] )

params.label: $sProvider
params.documentation: The name of the provider that owns the resource

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: [optional] Type of resource.This member can be 0 if it is not known.

_WinNet_GetUniversalName.label: _WinNet_GetUniversalName ( $sLocalPath )

params.label: $sLocalPath
params.documentation: Drive based path for a network resource

_WinNet_GetUser.documentation: Retrieves the default user name, or the user name used to establish a connection
_WinNet_GetUser.label: _WinNet_GetUser ( $sName )

params.label: $sName
params.documentation: Either the name of a local device that has been redirected to a network resource, or the remotename of a network resource to which a connection has been made without redirecting a local device.If blank, the system returns the name of the current user for the process.

_WinNet_OpenEnum.documentation: Starts an enumeration of network resources or existing connections
_WinNet_OpenEnum.label: _WinNet_OpenEnum ( $iScope, $iType, $iUsage, $tResource, ByRef $hEnum )

params.label: $iScope
params.documentation: Scope of the enumeration:    0 - Enumerate all currently connected resources    1 - Enumerate all resources on the network    2 - Enumerate all remembered (persistent) connections    3 - Enumerate only resources in the network context of the caller

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: Resource types:    0 - All resources    1 - Disk resources    2 - Print resources

params.label: $iUsage
params.documentation: Resource usage types:    0 - All resources    1 - All connectable resources    2 - All container resources    4 - Forces the function to fail if the user is not authenticated

params.label: $tResource
params.documentation: a $tagNETRESOURCE structure that specifies the container to enumerate or a pointer to it.If $iScope is not 1, this must be 0.If 0, the root of the network is assumed.

params.label: $hEnum
params.documentation: On return, a handle that can be used in calls to _WinNet_EnumResource()

_WinNet_RestoreConnection.documentation: Restores the connection to a network resource
_WinNet_RestoreConnection.label: _WinNet_RestoreConnection ( [$sDevice = "" [, $hWnd = 0 [, $bUseUI = True]]] )

params.label: $sDevice
params.documentation: [optional] The local name of the drive to connect to, such as "Z:".If blank, the function reconnects all persistent drives stored in the registry for the current user.

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: [optional] Handle to the parent window that the function uses to display the user interface that promptsthe user for a name and password when making the network connection.If 0, there is no owner window.

params.label: $bUseUI
params.documentation: [optional] If True, display a username/password prompt to the caller

_WinNet_UseConnection.documentation: Connects a local device to a network resource
_WinNet_UseConnection.label: _WinNet_UseConnection ( $hWnd, $sLocalName, $sRemoteName [, $sUserName = 0 [, $sPassword = 0 [, $iType = 1 [, $iOptions = 1]]]] )

params.label: $hWnd
params.documentation: Handle to a window that the provider of network resources can use as an owner window for dialogs.Use this parameter if you set bit 2 (interactive) in the Options parameter.This parameter can be 0.

params.label: $sLocalName
params.documentation: Name of a local device to be redirected, such as "F:" or "LPT1".The string is treated in a case-insensitive manner.If 0, a connection to the network resource is made without redirecting the local device.

params.label: $sRemoteName
params.documentation: Name of the network resource to connect to

params.label: $sUsername
params.documentation: [optional] User name for making the connection.If 0, the function uses the default user name.

params.label: $sPassword
params.documentation: [optional] Password to be used to make a connection.If 0, the default password is used. If the string is empty, no password is used.

params.label: $iType
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the type of network resource to connect to:    0 - Any (only if $sLocalName is blank)    1 - Disk    2 - Print

params.label: $iOptions
params.documentation: [optional] Connection options. Can be one or more of the following:    1 - The network resource connection should be remembered    2 - The operating system may interact with the user for authentication purposes    4 - The system does not use any default setting for user names or passwords without offering the user the        opportunity to supply an alternative.        This flag is ignored unless bit 2 (interactive) is also set.    8 - Forces the redirection of a local device when making the connection    16 - The operating system prompts the user for authentication using the command line instead of a GUI.        This flag is ignored unless bit 2 (interactive) is also set.    32 - If this bit is set, and the operating system prompts for a credential, the credential is saved by the credential manager.        If the credential manager is disabled for the caller's logon session, or if the network        provider does not support saving credentials, this flag is ignored.        This flag is also ignored unless you set bit 5 (command line instead of GUI).

_Word_Create.documentation: Connects to an existing Word instance or creates a new Word application object
_Word_Create.label: _Word_Create ( [$bVisible = True [, $bForceNew = False]] )

params.label: $bVisible
params.documentation: [optional] True specifies that the window will be visible (default)

params.label: $bForceNew
params.documentation: [optional] True forces to create a new Word instance even if there is already a running instance (default = False)

_Word_DocAdd.documentation: Adds a new or empty document to the specified Word application
_Word_DocAdd.label: _Word_DocAdd ( $oAppl [, $iDocumentType = $WdNewBlankDocument [, $sDocumentTemplate = "" [, $bNewTemplate = False]]] )

params.label: $oAppl
params.documentation: Word object returned by a preceding call to _Word_Create()

params.label: $iDocumentType
params.documentation: [optional] Can be one of the following WdNewDocumentType constants:    $WdNewBlankDocument, $WdNewEmailMessage, $WdNewFrameset or $WdNewWebPage (default = $WdNewBlankDocument)

params.label: $sDocumentTemplate
params.documentation: [optional] The name of the template to be used for the new document.If this argument is omitted, the Normal template is used (default = "")

params.label: $bNewTemplate
params.documentation: [optional] True to open the document as a template (default = False)

_Word_DocAttach.documentation: Attaches to the first instance of a Word document where the search string matches based on the selected mode
_Word_DocAttach.label: _Word_DocAttach ( $oAppl, $sString [, $sMode = "FilePath" [, $iCase = 0]] )

params.label: $oAppl
params.documentation: Word object returned by a preceding call to _Word_Create()

params.label: $sString
params.documentation: String to search for

params.label: $sMode
params.documentation: [optional] Search mode to use. Valid modes are:    "FileName" - Name of the open document    "FilePath" - Full path to the open document (default)    "Text" - Text in the body of the document

params.label: $iCase
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies case-sensitivity of function StringInStr() used for search mode "Text":    0 - not case-sensitive, using the user's locale (default)    1 - case sensitive    2 - not case sensitive, using a basic/faster comparison

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

params.label: $iSaveChanges
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the save action for the document (default = $WdDoNotSaveChanges).Can be one of the WdSaveOptions constants:    $WdDoNotSaveChanges, $WdPromptToSaveChanges or $WdSaveChanges

params.label: $iOriginalFormat
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the save format for the document.Can be one of the WdOriginalFormat constants:    $WdOriginalDocumentFormat, $WdPromptUser or $WdWordDocument (default = $WdOriginalDocumentFormat)

_Word_DocExport.documentation: Exports the document or a range as PDF or XPS
_Word_DocExport.label: _Word_DocExport ( $oDoc, $sFileName [, $iFormat = $WdExportFormatPDF [, $iRange = $WdExportAllDocument [, $iFrom = Default [, $iTo = Default [, $bOpenAfterExport = False [, $bIncludeProperties = True [, $iCreateBookmarks = Default [, $bUseISO19005 = False]]]]]]]] )

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object to be exported

params.label: $sFileName
params.documentation: Path/name of the exported file

params.label: $iFormat
params.documentation: [optional] Format to use for the export. Can be any of the WdExportFormat enumeration(default = $WdExportFormatPDF)

params.label: $iRange
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies what to export. Can be any of the WdExportRange enumeration(default = $WdExportAllDocument)

params.label: $iFrom
params.documentation: [optional] The page number at which to start publishing (default = start at the beginning)

params.label: $iTo
params.documentation: [optional] The page number at which to end publishing (default = end at the last page)

params.label: $bOpenAfterExport
params.documentation: [optional] True displays the file in a viewer after it is published (default = False)

params.label: $bIncludeProperties
params.documentation: [optional] True indicates that document properties should be included (default = True)

params.label: $iCreateBookmarks
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether to export bookmarks and the type of bookmarks to export.Can be any of the WdExportCreateBookmarks enumeration (default)

params.label: $bUseISO19005
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether the export should be created as PDF/A (self-contained PDF) (default = False)

_Word_DocFind.documentation: Runs or repeats the specified find operation
_Word_DocFind.label: _Word_DocFind ( $oDoc [, $sFindText = "" [, $vSearchRange = 0 [, $oFindRange = Default [, $bForward = True [, $bMatchCase = False [, $bMatchWholeWord = False [, $bMatchWildcards = False [, $bMatchSoundsLike = False [, $bMatchAllWordForms = False [, $bFormat = False]]]]]]]]]] )

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

params.label: $sFindText
params.documentation: [optional] The text to be searched for. Use an empty string ("") to search for formatting only.You can search for special characters by specifying appropriate character codes.For example, "^p" corresponds to a paragraph mark and "^t" corresponds to a tab character (default = "")

params.label: $vSearchRange
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the selection or range to search. Can be:    -1 - Specifies the current selection  0 - Specifies the entire document (default)Any Word range object

params.label: $oFindRange
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the range returned by the last call to _Word_DocFind().This is required if you want to search for the next or previous occurrence of $sFindText.If set to Default then the search starts at the start of the $vSearchRange (default)

params.label: $bForward
params.documentation: [optional] True to search forward (toward the end of the document) (default = True)

params.label: $bMatchCase
params.documentation: [optional] If True the find is case sensitive (default = False)

params.label: $bMatchWholeWord
params.documentation: [optional] If True only find entire words (default = False)

params.label: $bMatchWildcards
params.documentation: [optional] If True the find text has special search operators (default = False)

params.label: $bMatchSoundsLike
params.documentation: [optional] If True finds words that sound similar to the find text (default = False)

params.label: $bMatchAllWordForms
params.documentation: [optional] If True finds all forms of the find text(e.g. "sit" locates "sitting" and "sat") (default = False)

params.label: $bFormat
params.documentation: [optional] True to have the find operation locate formatting in addition to or instead of the find text (default = False)

_Word_DocFindReplace.documentation: Runs the specified find and replace operation
_Word_DocFindReplace.label: _Word_DocFindReplace ( $oDoc [, $sFindText = "" [, $sReplaceWith = "" [, $iReplace = $WdReplaceAll [, $vSearchRange = 0 [, $bMatchCase = False [, $bMatchWholeWord = False [, $bMatchWildcards = False [, $bMatchSoundsLike = False [, $bMatchAllWordForms = False [, $bForward = True [, $iWrap = $WdFindContinue [, $bFormat = False]]]]]]]]]]]] )

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

params.label: $sFindText
params.documentation: [optional] The text to be searched for. Use an empty string ("") to search for formatting only.You can search for special characters by specifying appropriate character codes.For example, "^p" corresponds to a paragraph mark and "^t" corresponds to a tab character (default = "")

params.label: $sReplaceWith
params.documentation: [optional] The replacement text. To delete found text use an empty string ("").You specify special characters and advanced search criteria just as you do for the Find argument (default = "")

params.label: $iReplace
params.documentation: [optional] How many replacements are to be made: one, all, or none.Can be anyWdReplace constant (default = $WdReplaceAll)

params.label: $vSearchRange
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the selection or range to search. Can be:    -1 - Specifies the current selection     0 - Specifies the entire document (default)Any Word range object.

params.label: $bMatchCase
params.documentation: [optional] If True the find is case sensitive (default = False)

params.label: $bMatchWholeWord
params.documentation: [optional] If True only find entire words (default = False)

params.label: $bMatchWildcards
params.documentation: [optional] If True the find text has special search operators (default = False)

params.label: $bMatchSoundsLike
params.documentation: [optional] If True finds words that sound similar to the find text (default = False)

params.label: $bMatchAllWordForms
params.documentation: [optional] If True finds all forms of the find text(e.g. "sit" locates "sitting" and "sat") (default = False)

params.label: $bForward
params.documentation: [optional] True to search forward (toward the end of the document) (default = True)

params.label: $iWrap
params.documentation: [optional] True wraps when the bottom or top of the document, selection or range is reached.Can be one of the WdFindWrap constants (default = $WdFindContinue)

params.label: $bFormat
params.documentation: [optional] True to have the find operation locate formatting in addition to or instead of the find text (default = False)

_Word_DocGet.documentation: Returns a collection object containing all documents or an object for a single document
_Word_DocGet.label: _Word_DocGet ( $oAppl [, $vIndex = -1] )

params.label: $oAppl
params.documentation: Word object returned by a preceding call to _Word_Create()

params.label: $vIndex
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies what to return:    -1 - Returns a collection of all documents (default)     0 - Returns the active document     n - The index number of the document to return (1 based)     x - The name of the document to return

_Word_DocLinkAdd.documentation: Adds a hyperlink to the document
_Word_DocLinkAdd.label: _Word_DocLinkAdd ( $oDoc [, $oAnchor = Default [, $sAddress = Default [, $sSubAddress = Default [, $sScreenTip = Default [, $sTextToDisplay = Default [, $sTarget = Default]]]]]] )

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

params.label: $oAnchor
params.documentation: [optional] Range object for the text or graphic to be turned into a hyperlink(default = Use entire document as range)

params.label: $sAddress
params.documentation: [optional] The address for the specified link.The address can be an E-mail address, an Internet address or a file name (default = link to the specified document is used)

params.label: $sSubAddress
params.documentation: [optional] The name of a location within the destination file, such as a bookmark, named rangeor slide number (default = None)

params.label: $sScreenTip
params.documentation: [optional] The text that appears as a ScreenTip when the mouse pointer is positioned over thespecified hyperlink (default = Uses value of $sAddress)

params.label: $sTextToDisplay
params.documentation: [optional] The display text of the specified hyperlink.The value of this argument replaces the text or graphic specified by $oAnchor (default = Uses value of $sAddress)

params.label: $sTarget
params.documentation: [optional] The name of the frame or window in which you want to load the specified hyperlink

_Word_DocLinkGet.documentation: Returns a collection object containing all links in the document or a single link object
_Word_DocLinkGet.label: _Word_DocLinkGet ( $oDoc [, $iIndex = Default] )

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

params.label: $iIndex
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies what to return:    Default - Returns a collection of all links (default)    n - The index number of the link to return (1 based)

params.label: $oAppl
params.documentation: Word object returned by a preceding call to _Word_Create()

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: The name or full path of the document to open

params.label: $bConfirmConversions
params.documentation: [optional] True displays the Convert File dialog if the file isn't in Word format (default = False)

params.label: $iFormat
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the format to use when opening the document.Can be any of the WdOpenFormat enumeration (default = $WdOpenFormatAuto = the existing format)

params.label: $bReadOnly
params.documentation: [optional] True to open the document as read-only (default = False).Note: This argument doesn't override the read-only recommended setting on a saved document.

params.label: $bRevert
params.documentation: [optional] Controls what happens if $sFilePath is the name of an open document.    True to discard any unsaved changes to the open document and reopen the file.    False to activate the open document (default = False)

params.label: $bAddToRecentFiles
params.documentation: [optional] True adds the file name to the list of recently used files at the bottom of the File menu (default = False)

params.label: $sOpenPassword
params.documentation: [optional] The password for opening the document

params.label: $sWritePassword
params.documentation: [optional] The password for saving changes to the document

_Word_DocPictureAdd.documentation: Adds a picture to the document
_Word_DocPictureAdd.label: _Word_DocPictureAdd ( $oDoc, $sFilePath [, $bLinkToFile = False [, $bSaveWithDocument = False [, $oRange = 0]]] )

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

params.label: $sFilePath
params.documentation: The path and file name of the picture

params.label: $bLinkToFile
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether to link the picture to the file from which it was created.    True - Link the picture to the file from which it was created    False - Make the picture an independent copy of the file (default)

params.label: $bSaveWithDocument
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies whether to save the linked picture with the document.    True - Save the linked picture with the document    False - Do not save the linked picture with the document (default)

params.label: $oRange
params.documentation: [optional] The location where the picture will be placed in the text.Can be 0 (the picture is placed automatically) or any range object (default = 0)

_Word_DocPrint.documentation: Prints all or parts of the specified document
_Word_DocPrint.label: _Word_DocPrint ( $oDoc [, $bBackground = False [, $iCopies = 1 [, $iOrientation = -1 [, $bCollate = True [, $sPrinter = "" [, $iRange = $WdPrintAllDocument [, $vFrom = 0 [, $vTo = 0 [, $sPages = "" [, $iPageType = $WdPrintAllPages [, $iItem = $WdPrintDocumentContent]]]]]]]]]]] )

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

params.label: $bBackground
params.documentation: [optional] True lets the script continue while the document is printed (default = False)

params.label: $iCopies
params.documentation: [optional] The number of copies to be printed (default = 1)

params.label: $iOrientation
params.documentation: [optional] Sets the orientation of the page:    -1 - Use current document orientation (default)     0 - Portrait ($WdOrientPortrait of the WdOrientation enumeration)     1 - Landscape ($WdOrientLandscape of the WdOrientation enumeration)

params.label: $bCollate
params.documentation: [optional] True prints all pages of the document before printing the next copy (default = True)

params.label: $sPrinter
params.documentation: [optional] Sets the name of the printer (default = "" = Active printer)

params.label: $iRange
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the page range to print.Can be any of the WdPrintOutRange enumeration.(default = $WdPrintAllDocument = print the entire document)

params.label: $vFrom
params.documentation: [optional] The starting page number (integer) when $iRange is set to $WdPrintFromTo

params.label: $vTo
params.documentation: [optional] The ending page number (integer) when $iRange is set to $WdPrintFromTo

params.label: $sPages
params.documentation: [optional] The page numbers and page ranges to be printed, separated by commas when $iRange is set to 4.For example, "2, 6-10" prints page 2 and pages 6 through 10 (default = "")

params.label: $iPageType
params.documentation: [optional] The type of pages to be printed. Can be any of the WdPrintOutPages enumeration(default = $WdPrintAllPages = print all pages)

params.label: $iItem
params.documentation: [optional] The item to be printed. Can be any of the WdPrintOutItem enumeration(default = $WdPrintDocumentContent = document content)

_Word_DocRangeSet.documentation: Sets or modifies a range in a document
_Word_DocRangeSet.label: _Word_DocRangeSet ( $oDoc, $vRange [, $iStartUnit = Default [, $iStartCount = Default [, $iEndUnit = Default [, $iEndCount = Default]]]] )

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

params.label: $vRange
params.documentation: Range to set or extend. You can pass an existing range which then is extended. Also valid is:     0 - uses the current selection as range    -1 - sets the range start/end at the start of the document    -2 - sets the range start/end at the end of the document

params.label: $iStartUnit
params.documentation: [optional] Unit by/to which the start position of the range is to be moved/set.Can be any of the WdUnit enumeration (default = $WdWord).When set to -1 the range is collapsed to the start of the range

params.label: $iStartCount
params.documentation: [optional] Number of units by/to which the start of range is moved/set.Positive numbers move the range forward in the document.If the position is moved forward to a position beyond the end position of the range, the range is collapsedand both the start and end positions are moved together(default = don't move the start position)

params.label: $iEndUnit
params.documentation: [optional] Unit by/to which the end position of the range is to be moved/set.Can be any of the WdUnit enumeration (default = $WdWord).When set to -1 the range is collapsed to the end of the range

params.label: $iEndCount
params.documentation: [optional] Number of units by/to which the end of the range is moved/set.If this number is negative, the end is moved backward.If the ending position overtakes the starting position, the rangecollapses and both positions move together (default = don't move the end position)

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

_Word_DocSaveAs.documentation: Saves the specified Word document with a new name or format
_Word_DocSaveAs.label: _Word_DocSaveAs ( $oDoc [, $sFileName = Default [, $iFileFormat = $WdFormatDocument [, $bReadOnlyRecommended = False [, $bAddToRecentFiles = True [, $sPassword = "" [, $sWritePassword = ""]]]]]] )

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

params.label: $sFileName
params.documentation: [optional] The full path name for the document (default = Current folder and current file name).If the document has never been saved, the default name is used (for example, Doc1.doc)

params.label: $iFileFormat
params.documentation: [optional] The format in which the document is saved.Can be any WdSaveFormat constant (default = $WdFormatDocument)

params.label: $bReadOnlyRecommended
params.documentation: [optional] True to have Word suggest read-only status whenever the document is opened (default = False)

params.label: $bAddToRecentFiles
params.documentation: [optional] True to add the document to the list of recently used files (default = True)

params.label: $sPassword
params.documentation: [optional] A password string for opening the document (default = "")

params.label: $sWritePassword
params.documentation: [optional] A password string for saving changes to the document (default = "")

_Word_DocTableRead.documentation: Reads a Word table and returns the content as a two-dimensional array
_Word_DocTableRead.label: _Word_DocTableRead ( $oDoc, $vTable [, $iIndexBase = Default [, $sDelimiter = Default]] )

params.label: $oDoc
params.documentation: Word document object

params.label: $vTable
params.documentation: Table object or index of the table in the table collection

params.label: $iIndexBase
params.documentation: [optional] Can be 0 or 1 and specifies if the array starts with row 0 or 1 (default = 1)

params.label: $sDelimiter
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the character used to separate text into cells (default = @TAB)

_Word_DocTableWrite.documentation: Writes a one or two dimensional array to a Word table
_Word_DocTableWrite.label: _Word_DocTableWrite ( $oRange, ByRef $aArray [, $iIndexBase = Default [, $sDelimiter = Default]] )

params.label: $oRange
params.documentation: Word range object where the table should be inserted

params.label: $aArray
params.documentation: one or two-dimensional array to be converted to a table.Can be zero or 1-based

params.label: $iIndexBase
params.documentation: [optional] Can be 0 or 1 and specifies if the array starts with row 0 or 1 (default = 1)

params.label: $sDelimiter
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies the character used to separate text into cells (default = @TAB)

_Word_Quit.documentation: Closes all documents, the Word application and removes the object reference to it
_Word_Quit.label: _Word_Quit ( $oAppl [, $iSaveChanges = $WdDoNotSaveChanges [, $iOriginalFormat = $WdWordDocument [, $bForceClose = False]]] )

params.label: $oAppl
params.documentation: Word object returned by a preceding call to _Word_Create()

params.label: $iSaveChanges
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies if changed documents should be saved before closing.Can be one of the WdSaveOptions enumeration (default = $WdDoNotSaveChanges)

params.label: $iOriginalFormat
params.documentation: [optional] Specifies how Word saves documents whose original format was not Word document format.Can be any of the WdOriginalFormat enumeration (default = $WdWordDocument)

params.label: $bForceClose
params.documentation: [optional] If True the Word application is closed even when it was running at _Word_Create() time (default = False)
